subject: Clean invalid resources from ceilometer-compute
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-11 12:18:00.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/tests/unit/test_novaclient.py', 'ceilometer/tests/unit/compute/test_discovery.py', 'ceilometer/compute/discovery.py', 'ceilometer/nova_client.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer/commit/f23418a5cae67a4e2c2348b14c77c2871a681cc5', 'message': "Clean invalid resources from ceilometer-compute

When booting instance and schedulered to host, ceilometer-compute will
collect sample for the instance's meter. The instance may error before
instance's state active, the  instance's host will be changed,

to collect instance meter.

Change-Id: Ib20ed987db68ec51cf653d58677407cafcb49ced
Closes-Bug: #1632308
"}]
commit_message:
Clean invalid resources from ceilometer-compute

When booting instance and schedulered to host, ceilometer-compute will
collect sample for the instance's meter. The instance may error before
instance's state active, the  instance's host will be changed,
ceilometer-compute won't know instances's state forever and still trying
to collect instance meter.

Change-Id: Ib20ed987db68ec51cf653d58677407cafcb49ced
Closes-Bug: #1632308

commit_message:
Add additional runner and env utils tests

Adds several tests to exercise more of runner and the env utils.

Makes several modifications to config.py, runner.py, and utils/env.py,
with the aim of making them more testable.

Change-Id: I708df9e5315f3dadd028c8107ac6416c707e90a0
Closes-Bug: #1634296

subject: Removing "config-dir", modifying "config-file"
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-28 23:38:49.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/syntribos/commit/dcd8324a7c173619a1710390c4ddc7bf1d4d7ac4', 'message': 'Removing "config-dir", modifying "config-file"

oslo_config automatically adds the "--config-file" and "--config-dir"
options when cfg.CONF is called to parse command line arguments. We
don't want to support multi-config, so this patch is meant to remove
that functionality and implement "--config-file" to work in a way
that's more fitting for this tool (i.e. no /etc/ defaults)

Change-Id: I2e715e2fb729fcee1b592aeef173e11f4162b35e
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-03 22:22:44.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/syntribos/commit/244de932cc2d392550193f9c14e596cb567fa955', 'message': 'Removing "config-dir", modifying "config-file"

oslo_config automatically adds the "--config-file" and "--config-dir"
options when cfg.CONF is called to parse command line arguments. We
don't want to support multi-config, so this patch is meant to remove
that functionality and implement "--config-file" to work in a way
that's more fitting for this tool (i.e. no /etc/ defaults)

STILL A WORK-IN-PROGRESS :(

Change-Id: I2e715e2fb729fcee1b592aeef173e11f4162b35e
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2016-08-12 22:18:31.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/syntribos/commit/0347b9b0fa63eb2c38f914db10784dfc719e07ae', 'message': 'Removing "config-dir", modifying "config-file"

oslo_config automatically adds the "--config-file" and "--config-dir"
options when cfg.CONF is called to parse command line arguments. We
don't want to support multi-config, so this patch is meant to remove
that functionality and implement "--config-file" to work in a way
that's more fitting for this tool (i.e. no /etc/ defaults)

This also involves setting up a ".syntribos" folder for the user, based
on whether they are using are using a virtualenv or not.

Still a work-in-progres...

Change-Id: I2e715e2fb729fcee1b592aeef173e11f4162b35e

options when cfg.CONF is called to parse command line arguments. We
don't want to support multi-config, so this patch is meant to remove
that functionality and implement "--config-file" to work in a way
that's more fitting for this tool (i.e. no /etc/ defaults)

This also involves setting up a ".syntribos" folder for the user, based
on whether they are using are using a virtualenv or not.

Change-Id: I2e715e2fb729fcee1b592aeef173e11f4162b35e
'}]
commit_message:
Removing "config-dir", modifying "config-file"

oslo_config automatically adds the "--config-file" and "--config-dir"
options when cfg.CONF is called to parse command line arguments. We
don't want to support multi-config, so this patch is meant to remove
that functionality and implement "--config-file" to work in a way
that's more fitting for this tool (i.e. no /etc/ defaults)

This also involves setting up a ".syntribos" folder for the user, based
on whether they are using are using a virtualenv or not.

Change-Id: I2e715e2fb729fcee1b592aeef173e11f4162b35e

commit_message:
Remove deprecated ansible_ssh_host variable

This changes 'ansible_ssh_host' to 'ansible_host'. The 'ansible_ssh_host'
variable has been deprecated as noted here: [0].

[0] - http://docs.ansible.com/ansible/intro_inventory.html#hosts-and-groups
Related-Bug: #1636606

Change-Id: I974c17d6c666a9bac0be1f6db93d0cb915ac0fe7

commit_message:
Increase haproxy client/server timeout for swift-proxy

The upload and extraction for the plan tarball to swift can take
longer than the default one minute in slower environments. Doubling
the timeout to two minutes has proven to help.

This is only a partial fix, because the error reporting for this
issue also needs to be improved.

Change-Id: I06592d38fdfefacc8bdf76289a0bfa20eb33a89b
Partial-Bug: 1635269
(cherry picked from commit 4887e187a6b83ff74feaec65fc839e5ac65f813b)

commit_message:
merge calico integration to kolla

adding calico driver into kolla.
adding all dependencies of calico etcd and felix.
adding quagga dockerfile
adding ansible role for quagga
adding quagga/zebra password to gen list
split of etcd and etcd_proxy.
rebase for merge conflict

Partially-Implements: blueprint calico

Change-Id: Ifb0211064493e3ff6e826f4b23da2300810e16d8

commit_message:
Security: Add tasks for RHEL-07-010020

This patch adds tasks which check for files that have been modified
since their packages were installed. This can sometimes be sign
of compromise.

Any files failing checksum validation are displayed for the deployer
to review.

Implements: blueprint security-rhel7-stig
Change-Id: I5ccc375ecb08e51c51dab80b47a190050731f700
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-security refs/changes/83/385583/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Security: Add tasks for RHEL-07-010010

This patch adds tasks to check for files which have had their
permissions or ownership modified since they were installed.

To avoid running RPM verification multiple times, the report is
gathered up front one time and then parsed quickly with grep in
subsequent tasks.

Implements: blueprint security-rhel7-stig
Change-Id: I170176319ac6dcda5f736fa90eb4eb47c4ce76b8

commit_message:
Creates syntribos 'init' command

This command will set up the basics needed for a syntribos environment
(i.e. template folder, payload folder, log folder, default config file)

Some modifications have also been made to Runner to facilitate these
changes. These changes will (hopefully) allow us to better unit test
components of the runner.

Change-Id: I001e798b89539468cfbd92d5df301f7e59f1f33d

subject: Allow custom Type value in heka decoders.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-04 12:32:04.000000000', 'files': ['docker/heka/plugins/decoders/os_horizon_apache_log.lua', 'docker/heka/plugins/decoders/os_keystone_apache_log.lua', 'docker/heka/plugins/decoders/os_swift_log.lua', 'docker/heka/plugins/decoders/os_mysql_log.lua', 'docker/heka/plugins/decoders/os_openstack_log.lua', 'docker/heka/plugins/decoders/os_syslog.lua', 'docker/heka/plugins/decoders/os_rabbitmq_log.lua'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla/commit/c15c79a18c547244e26d8b8f42ce8cfd770112f3', 'message': 'Allow custom Type value in heka decoders.

Heka sends messages composed of different fields (index, Type, Timestamp ...)
indexed by elasticsearch. The "Type" is set to the hard-coded value "log"
during the decoding phase. The purpose here is to allow the customization of
the Type value. One benefit is that logs of two different OpenStack instances
sent to the same indexing engine may be easily filtered using this field.

Current limitation :
This customization is not exposed through an ansible variable.

Example of configuration using a custom "Type" value:

[openstack_log_decoder]
type = "SandboxDecoder"
filename = "lua_decoders/os_openstack_log.lua"

[openstack_log_decoder.config]
type = "mycustomvalue"

Change-Id: I4ea8fb3086808ca241ca24e76fc6b877a65eadd4
Closes-Bug: #1629463
'}]
commit_message:
Allow custom Type value in heka decoders.

Heka sends messages composed of different fields (index, Type, Timestamp ...)
indexed by elasticsearch. The "Type" is set to the hard-coded value "log"
during the decoding phase. The purpose here is to allow the customization of
the Type value. One benefit is that logs of two different OpenStack instances
sent to the same indexing engine may be easily filtered using this field.

Current limitation :
This customization is not exposed through an ansible variable.

Example of configuration using a custom "Type" value:

[openstack_log_decoder]
type = "SandboxDecoder"
filename = "lua_decoders/os_openstack_log.lua"

[openstack_log_decoder.config]
type = "mycustomvalue"

Change-Id: I4ea8fb3086808ca241ca24e76fc6b877a65eadd4
Closes-Bug: #1629463
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/64/381764/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fixing unicode error

When syntribos attempts to download templates, it fails with
unicode error. This patch fixes it.

Closes-Bug: #1636609

commit_message:
Resolve random node selection in repo build

In some cases the multiple archetecture support in a multi-node cloud
will select nodes incapable of sync'ing data outside of themselves as
primary build targets. This patch ensures that a known group of
"repo_nodes" is created at run-time and consists of unique hosts with
unique archetectures provided the hostname does not match the first
node within the "repo_all" group.

Closes-Bug: #1633784
Change-Id: Ifdfabf3b2ef147d287263f2c79c676267fbdea3c
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/65/389965/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix display of chassis UUID field if empty

When calling OSC commands "openstack baremetal node create" or
"openstack baremetal node show" the field "chassis_uuid" should be
displayed even if it is empty.

This patch also updated the test schema for the ironic --json node-*
command as chassis_uuid will now appear as 'null' when the node isn't
associated with a chassis.

Change-Id: Ic10eb9ef908c12d5c71c1df407bfb66079a25703
Closes-Bug: #1620749

commit_message:
Better error handling of QP errors

Quick property URIs could sometimes not embed a response.  This is
generally an API issue and changes have gone into pypowervm for it.
However, nova-powervm should also be more tolerant of this.

This change supports better toleration in the event that the error
raised from the REST API does not have a proper response.

Change-Id: I490731a342a3045887a47c1051448e9cd2eabb15
Closes-Bug: 1635385
(cherry picked from commit af3aebdd8de62df7075aff31ab92f268d98dbeb6)

commit_message:
Add instructions for configuration files

We instruct the reader setting up the second NIC to edit configuration
files instead of using Yast. We should do the same for the first NIC.

Change-Id: I3de47eb034ecfad69ac8a90a348b507d9d48728c

commit_message:
Implement upper constraints for Ansible bootstrap

Currently the Ansible bootstrap does not make use of upper
constraints, resulting in an inconsistent set of package
versions for the same tag.

This patch ensures that the upper constraints are applied
to the Ansible bootstrap.

This, much like the pinning we do elsewhere, ensures that
when OpenStack-Ansible is installed from a tag it uses the
exact same package versions as those that were tested and
it produces consistent results.

Combined backport of:
- https://review.openstack.org/388051
- https://review.openstack.org/390501

Change-Id: I61499631fa211ea482c79b2067d09889d9530b40
(cherry picked from commit f2fc0428e6718a77ab901af4cf930496ec212c0f)

subject: Better error handling of QP errors
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-20 20:19:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova-powervm/commit/dbabe208006f793a0363b077aa1fe84541b34d48', 'message': "Support additional responses for qp's

The quick property queries can return either 404 or 406 errors.  They're
generally HTTPError's though, indicating that the LPAR doesn't exist.
All other errors should be raised up.

The method did not take into account the 406 error's and could cause
issues.  It increased the verbosity in the logs and led to bad error
messages.  This fixes it, makes sure we only catch HttpErrors and raise
up the others.

Change-Id: I490731a342a3045887a47c1051448e9cd2eabb15
Closes-Bug: 1635385
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-10-26 16:40:21.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova-powervm/commit/9daa89c2e845390ebdf19780f0ade4ff4a7f4bac', 'message': "Support additional responses for qp's

The quick property queries can return either 404 or 406 errors.  They're
generally HTTPError's though, indicating that the LPAR doesn't exist.
All other errors should be raised up.

The method did not take into account the 406 error's and could cause
issues.  It increased the verbosity in the logs and led to bad error
messages.  This fixes it, makes sure we only catch HttpErrors and raise
up the others.

Change-Id: I490731a342a3045887a47c1051448e9cd2eabb15
Closes-Bug: 1635385
"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2016-10-26 16:42:06.000000000', 'files': ['nova_powervm/tests/virt/powervm/test_vm.py', 'nova_powervm/virt/powervm/vm.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova-powervm/commit/af3aebdd8de62df7075aff31ab92f268d98dbeb6', 'message': 'Better error handling of QP errors

Quick property URIs could sometimes not embed a response.  This is
generally an API issue and changes have gone into pypowervm for it.
However, nova-powervm should also be more tolerant of this.

This change supports better toleration in the event that the error
raised from the REST API does not have a proper response.

Change-Id: I490731a342a3045887a47c1051448e9cd2eabb15
Closes-Bug: 1635385
'}]
commit_message:
Better error handling of QP errors

Quick property URIs could sometimes not embed a response.  This is
generally an API issue and changes have gone into pypowervm for it.
However, nova-powervm should also be more tolerant of this.

This change supports better toleration in the event that the error
raised from the REST API does not have a proper response.

Change-Id: I490731a342a3045887a47c1051448e9cd2eabb15
Closes-Bug: 1635385

commit_message:
Fix Ansible bootstrap upper constraint use

When bootstrapping the Ansible runtime venv the version of
pip in the initial venv might be old and unable to understand
the --constraint option.

This patch ensures that the pip, setuptools and wheel upgrade
does not try to use the --constraint option (they're fixed pins
anyway so it's not needed) and then applies the --constraint
option once we know we're at the right version of pip.

Change-Id: Ic482493c800362b896bfe5083b253f1d33d809b5

commit_message:
Only restart haproxy services when enable_load_balancer is defined

If we upgrade a cloud that was configured with external load balancer
the process will fail during convergence step because it will try to
restart haproxy which is not configured when an external load balancer
is configured.

Closes-Bug: #1636527

Change-Id: I6f6caec3e5c96e77437c1c83e625f39649a66c48
(cherry picked from commit cf4166ff5defb90acd7ffa4d3df3dda606cbd1ec)

commit_message:
Enable fixed mac address generation

This change allows neutron-agent and rabbitmq containers to use a fixed
mac address which should ensure that we're not running into prolonged
downtime due to mac address rotations caused by container restarts.

Change-Id: I6e1028396090fafcd73f12f7db717ffc915e3c74
Backported-From: I55198787afd5a0384d6098871a14053a7ee0032c
Depends-On: I591f3fb58150b5bb0a32ffdf338e54de6af11b5f
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Modify the "create" and "update" method in lbaas driver_v2

Adding the object synchronized with ODL in “create” and “update”
method in lbaas driver_v2, it should not be None.

Change-Id: Iaab01d26f4a4eda78e158c62eaf2ccdb047cf00b
Closes-Bug: #1633030

commit_message:
Remove pecan_debug option

There's no need to have that option exposed to users, as they never need
it. A developer who needs it can just add it as it fits. Though I never
used it.

commit_message:
Implement upper constraints for Ansible bootstrap

Currently the Ansible bootstrap does not make use of upper
constraints, resulting in an inconsistent set of package
versions for the same tag.

This patch ensures that the upper constraints are applied
to the Ansible bootstrap.

This, much like the pinning we do elsewhere, ensures that
when OpenStack-Ansible is installed from a tag it uses the
exact same package versions as those that were tested and
it produces consistent results.

Manual backport of https://review.openstack.org/388051

Change-Id: I61499631fa211ea482c79b2067d09889d9530b40
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/81/389781/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Removes EnableODL heat parameter and fixes missing local_ip param

EnableOpenDaylightOnController was not very composable.  Removing this
parameter to make the service truly composable.  Also fixes missing
local_ip setting for OVS, required for VXLAN or GRE tenant networks.

Closes-Bug: 1633625

Depends-On: Ia55c05e12d5d434111a13e1ed795da530e3ff4a5

Change-Id: I0e07e1631793311334d1436ee8fdf9af2802ba70
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 59f19b5e37cfd970a10ece2775f2a6a4b0e508f8)

commit_message:
Switch hacking.checks from neutron to neutron_lib

Per armax recommendation in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/374425/,
moving away from the neutron hacking checks, using neutron_lib hacking
checks instead.

We need to bypass N530 (direct neutron imports not allowed) for the
forseeable future.

Change-Id: I05804844445575a55ab33273b88fd3a5ff9df179
Closes-Bug: #1626298
(cherry picked from commit 00cbb6188896bd290fa7631defa9d5f204ad0724)

subject: Remove double tcp_listen_options entries for rabbit
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-19 13:18:11.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/77079145acc4794ca623516d13458cb6b345903d', 'message': "Remove double tcp_listen_options entries for rabbit

After a brand new deployment we have the following in rabbitmq.config:
...
  {rabbit, [
    {tcp_listen_options,
         [binary,
         {packet,        raw},
         {reuseaddr,     true},
         {backlog,       128},
         {nodelay,       true},
         {exit_on_close, false}]
    },
    {tcp_listen_options, [binary, {packet, raw}, {reuseaddr, true},
{backlog, 128}, {nodelay, true}, {exit_on_close, false}, {keepalive,
true}]},
...

Let's remove these duplicate entries and make sure that we use the
parameters for the puppet module to set the following values
explicitely (it's the only parameter where we do not use the default
setting from the puppet module):
keepalive = true -> rabbitmq::tcp_keepalive: true

All the other options that we set are the default in the puppet module:
{packet, raw}
{reuseaddr, true}
{backlog, 128}{nodelay, true}
{exit_on_close, false}

Change-Id: I35921652bd84d1d6be0727051294983d4a0dde10
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-10-21 06:37:04.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/services/rabbitmq.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/c6ddaafe549e171f4daeab5a627f77712fafa32d', 'message': "Remove double tcp_listen_options entries for rabbit

{backlog, 128}, {nodelay, true}, {exit_on_close, false}, {keepalive,

...

Let's remove these duplicate entries and make sure that we use the
parameters for the puppet module to set the following values
explicitely (it's the only parameter where we do not use the default
setting from the puppet module):
keepalive = true -> rabbitmq::tcp_keepalive: true

All the other options that we set are the default in the puppet module:
{packet, raw}
{reuseaddr, true}
{backlog, 128}{nodelay, true}
{exit_on_close, false}

Depends-On: I608477d5714a5081b3b4ab3b9fc2932bdd598301
Change-Id: I35921652bd84d1d6be0727051294983d4a0dde10

commit_message:
Remove double tcp_listen_options entries for rabbit

After a brand new deployment we have the following in rabbitmq.config:
...
  {rabbit, [
    {tcp_listen_options,
         [binary,
         {packet,        raw},
         {reuseaddr,     true},
         {backlog,       128},
         {nodelay,       true},
         {exit_on_close, false}]
    },
    {tcp_listen_options, [binary, {packet, raw}, {reuseaddr, true},
{backlog, 128}, {nodelay, true}, {exit_on_close, false}, {keepalive,
true}]},
...

Let's remove these duplicate entries and make sure that we use the
parameters for the puppet module to set the following values
explicitely (it's the only parameter where we do not use the default
setting from the puppet module):
keepalive = true -> rabbitmq::tcp_keepalive: true

All the other options that we set are the default in the puppet module:
{packet, raw}
{reuseaddr, true}
{backlog, 128}{nodelay, true}
{exit_on_close, false}

Depends-On: I608477d5714a5081b3b4ab3b9fc2932bdd598301
Change-Id: I35921652bd84d1d6be0727051294983d4a0dde10
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/95/388695/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Fix usage of SwiftRawDisks
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-17 09:02:21.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/7ac8393c134403f31d702dfeff1d2169fd6deb01', 'message': 'Fix usage of SwiftRawDisks

Using the SwiftRawDisks parameter neither created the XFS filesystem nor
mounted the device, requiring manual intervention by an operaror.

It also kept the local "d1" device - which isn't a device at all, it's
just a directory on the root disk with the risk to overload or overfill
the system disk.

Closes-Bug: 1634051
Change-Id: I2da0f12635a37c1f339a3be59a7d00f352adf283

commit_message:
Fix usage of SwiftRawDisks

Using the SwiftRawDisks parameter neither created the XFS filesystem nor
mounted the device, requiring manual intervention by an operaror.

commit_message:
Deprecate auth_plugin option

Option "auth_plugin" from group "trustee" is deprecated in heat.conf.
Use option "auth_type" from group "trustee" instead.

commit_message:
[urgent] Fix multi-node installation guide about node_2

1. What is the problem?
Tricircle plugin is not installed in node_2 according to this guide.
Devstack on node_2 will fail because of this.

2. What is the solution to the problem?
Install tricircle in node_2 before running devstack.

3. What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle to realize the solution?
No new features.

Change-Id: I51902bb7b2abdfba282409fbc6d9f2c435b4dc9c
Signed-off-by: Alex Yang <yangyang1@zte.com.cn>

commit_message:
Revert "Adding more European clouds"

These quota changes were only for demo purposes, so put
configuration back to our pre-demo state for now. A subsequent
change will add proper quotas for some of these providers again in
the near future.

This reverts commit ed35b7f0b00ea46c5086977d0981eeda3352634e.

Change-Id: I4db1dbab5e1a65cff3108413e259a1bfce4beff0

commit_message:
Updated for deprecated "ansible_ssh_user"

Ansible has changed the variable ansible_ssh_user to ansible_user
this change adds support for the option ansible_user while 
maintaining compatibility with the legacy option.

commit_message:
Added fix required to run on Ubuntu 14.04

When run with the NeCTAR Ubuntu 14.04 image the pip install of
the requirements.txt file fails because:

* pbr is already installed, and is an earlier version that that required
* there are other python packages required that are not installed.

This fix uses pip to upgrade the pbr version installed, and adds
the required packages to the requirments.txt file.

Closes-Bug: #1636150
Change-Id: I2b5a3988cfbaa1c2b6feec0a3e18dec805fcfb83

commit_message:
Deploy cinder over Apache httpd

This adds the necessary resources to the manifest to run cinder
to run over httpd. The service name will be moved to t-h-t in a
subsequent commit, but since this patch depends on t-h-t, we try to
avoid circular dependencies of repos.

Change-Id: I950257e3b5d8db071752e53557115429574e98e2
Depends-On: Ic1967a6f4f60a273965811516f33121115d518b4

commit_message:
Added fix required to run on Ubuntu 16.04

Due to bug
https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/supervisor/+bug/1594740
the install.sh script will fail when run on Ubuntu 16.04.

This commit adds the fix suggested in the Ubuntu bug report.

Change-Id: I1ffe7c9f1c1388576290f3444345791be9880a92
Closes-Bug: 1604912

commit_message:
[user-guide]Use "openstack" to replace "nova" command

This patch:
- Use "openstack" to replace "nova" command when gathering parameters to launch an instance
- update the "note" of available security groups

Implements: blueprint use-openstack-command
Change-Id: Ia8bc262e20efd19f2ab819489368a5d7a42fc243

commit_message:
Add instance to many log events

This change takes advantage of the oslo_log mechanism to pass the
instance in on log events.  It allows for better debugging.  This is not
a full audit of the whole project, but just a glance through of all the
obvious places.

Change-Id: I08962ce2757984e709cf51a4ae9ef654b7667d1a

commit_message:
Remove Mitaka stable compat job, adjust filtering for Newton

We recently introduced a new Newton stable compat job [1] for projects
such as the oslo libraries.

As things are now, it is currently voting in stable/mitaka branch
reviews and it is probably not expected for Newton jobs to be passing
on Mitaka backports. Example of such failing backport here [2].

This change is analogous to the adjustments we did when Mitaka
released [3].

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/375111/
[2]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/389190/
[3]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/295500/

Change-Id: I04112e13ca69998c069c9e30f55e1f069f902253

commit_message:
Use openstack command to replace other commands

Now the docs use different command-line client commands, in
order to promote the unity of the docs, there should use
openstack command to replace other commands.

Change-Id: I70426a2ee0bc97201371a9746b12cb2dd46b4475

subject: Support segregated function for upload
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-25 23:34:57.000000000', 'files': ['nova_powervm/tests/virt/powervm/disk/test_ssp.py', 'nova_powervm/virt/powervm/disk/ssp.py', 'nova_powervm/tests/virt/powervm/disk/test_driver.py', 'nova_powervm/tests/virt/powervm/disk/test_localdisk.py', 'nova_powervm/virt/powervm/disk/localdisk.py', 'nova_powervm/virt/powervm/disk/driver.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova-powervm/commit/e2a9efc19cd2bc0b0fc79e55379a15270fca1860', 'message': 'Support segregated function for upload

The original PowerVM Glance code used a model where it would iterate
over the chunks and build a facade on top of that to make it look like a
stream.  We found that starting in Glance v2 that is not incredibly
reliable.

This has led to some bad deploys and reschedules on new hosts.

With this change set, we take advantage of a new feature in pypowervm
that allows us to pass in a function for the upload.  The function
passes in the path of where the image should be streamed to.  We can use
this to allow for the driver to just tell Glance to stream to a file.

Our initial tests shows this to be significantly more reliable (no
failed deploys since).  It also has an ancillary effect where the
download runs about two times faster.

Change-Id: I0fcc630b55290d6bb8fcd82230b58bed81afa4f8
Closes-Bug: #1636321
'}]
commit_message:
Support segregated function for upload

The original PowerVM Glance code used a model where it would iterate
over the chunks and build a facade on top of that to make it look like a
stream.  We found that starting in Glance v2 that is not incredibly
reliable.

This has led to some bad deploys and reschedules on new hosts.

With this change set, we take advantage of a new feature in pypowervm
that allows us to pass in a function for the upload.  The function
passes in the path of where the image should be streamed to.  We can use
this to allow for the driver to just tell Glance to stream to a file.

Our initial tests shows this to be significantly more reliable (no
failed deploys since).  It also has an ancillary effect where the
download runs about two times faster.

Change-Id: I0fcc630b55290d6bb8fcd82230b58bed81afa4f8
Closes-Bug: #1636321
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-powervm refs/changes/81/390681/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Support segregated function for upload

The original PowerVM Glance code used a model where it would iterate
over the chunks and build a facade on top of that to make it look like a
stream.  We found that starting in Glance v2 that is not incredibly
reliable.

This has led to some bad deploys and reschedules on new hosts.

With this change set, we take advantage of a new feature in pypowervm
that allows us to pass in a function for the upload.  The function
passes in the path of where the image should be streamed to.  We can use
this to allow for the driver to just tell Glance to stream to a file.

Our initial tests shows this to be significantly more reliable (no
failed deploys since).  It also has an ancillary effect where the
download runs about two times faster.

Change-Id: I0fcc630b55290d6bb8fcd82230b58bed81afa4f8
Closes-Bug: #1636321

commit_message:
Fix MYSQLD_STARTUP_TIMEOUT for systemd

The /etc/default/mysql file needs to be sourced for systemd to start
mysql with the appropriate MYSQLD_STARTUP_TIMEOUT value.

We are already adding the line to source the /etc/default/mysql file in
the init.d/mysql script, but we were skipping dropping the defaults file
when using "systemd".

Additionally, this groups the init file change and the default file
templating to be sequential.

Change-Id: If5dc328e67bde9d84f40c2b192c217e82e1987eb
Closes-Bug: #1634562

commit_message:
Add 'type_name' to Profile class to fix errors related with profile.type

When displaying Update Profile modal, it will raise error because profile
info doesn't have an attribute of 'type'. This patch will fix it by using
an attribute of 'type_name'.

Change-Id: Iadcac8eae2eca33c13cbe6acaad8a2a34a5df86f
Closes-Bug: #1636675

profile's name also can be use in some commands

When create profile, we use profile name only.
When we update cluster and node, we can use both profile id or name.

commit_message:
Only restart haproxy services when enable_load_balancer is defined

If we upgrade a cloud that was configured with external load balancer
the process will fail during convergence step because it will try to
restart haproxy which is not configured when an external load balancer
is configured.

Closes-Bug: #1636527

Change-Id: I6f6caec3e5c96e77437c1c83e625f39649a66c48
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo refs/changes/45/390545/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Include ceilometer in swift proxy pipeline

new ceilometermiddleware is available and integrated into
puppet-swift. Lets leverage it and include it in the
swift proxy pipeline. The correcponding puppet triple
change for this is Ie49f4a750368ff174b23b8d6baa743d0956d727e

Closes-Bug: #1631108

Change-Id: I82da0240d60d1eed54f1c0927e6157bb63025a19
(cherry picked from commit f1b509c8c856532a87b533cebf7ab8430393bf5c)

commit_message:
Promote gate to master

A fix was merged in Tempest so we need to update run_tests.sh to stop
pinning Tempest. Because of that we need to promote the repo otherwise
the downstream CI job will never update the packages.

After this patch got merged, we'll come back on the static URL.

- Unpin Tempest on CentOS
- Pin Tempest on Ubuntu (Ocata not packaged yet)

Change-Id: I2330faf700230fe40119169347ad72f8332d0821

subject: Remove the hardcoded tcp_keepalive false parameter
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-21 06:36:49.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/profile/base/rabbitmq.pp'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo/commit/ebc0c0c8a679643b6a2d0c86944b79d9c95b84fd', 'message': "Remove the hardcoded tcp_keepalive false parameter

In change I35921652bd84d1d6be0727051294983d4a0dde10 we want to remove
all those duplicate tcp_listen_option entries. One consequence of that
is that we need to set rabbitmq::tcp_keepalive to true via hiera
(as opposed to forcing it via the tcp_listen_option hash).

For this to work we need to remove this forced parameter override.
Note that even if I35921652bd84d1d6be0727051294983d4a0dde10 and this
change don't merge at the exact same time it is still okay because
we do force tcp_keepalive to true via the tcp_listen_options.

Change-Id: I608477d5714a5081b3b4ab3b9fc2932bdd598301
"}]
commit_message:
Remove the hardcoded tcp_keepalive false parameter

In change I35921652bd84d1d6be0727051294983d4a0dde10 we want to remove
all those duplicate tcp_listen_option entries. One consequence of that
is that we need to set rabbitmq::tcp_keepalive to true via hiera
(as opposed to forcing it via the tcp_listen_option hash).

For this to work we need to remove this forced parameter override.
Note that even if I35921652bd84d1d6be0727051294983d4a0dde10 and this
change don't merge at the exact same time it is still okay because
we do force tcp_keepalive to true via the tcp_listen_options.

Change-Id: I608477d5714a5081b3b4ab3b9fc2932bdd598301

commit_message:
Add py_req_cleanup macro to openstack-macros

This macro is intended to replace the functionality of the
req_cleanup block in renderspec, to allow removing the
*requirements.txt files from the Python source, letting RPM handle
dependencies itself.

Depends-On: I014fd8989aab247bc1c15280ab3879c6842d7b1d

Change-Id: I18c6914c40c280dfa7aba6f2ea845fc9a3ba0244

commit_message:
Validate type of allowed_address_pairs

If user don't pass "type=dict list=true" in create/update port
with allowed_address_pairs attribute, we will hit Quota exceed
exception. So we need to check address_pairs type in validation,
if allowed address pairs is not Python list, we should raise an
exception.

Change-Id: I7c84b728e8e660b678f251122cc332cd0ce5c576
Closes-Bug: #1631432

commit_message:
change gnocchi cache enable condition

In oslo_cache lib , we use `enabled` option to decide whether to
enable the cache or not. Old code doesn't work forever.

Change-Id: I749288034a8793213dace09de4cbe41de47160c9

commit_message:
Fix errors due to repo_service_user_name setting

Changing the paths of nginx logs to not rely on the
 user name of repo service. This is because nginx related
 configurations, playbooks assume nginx in the directory names.

Change-Id: I2fb0ec7a2f6a1d536363d1b2056394b6534287cf
Closes-Bug: #1633739
(cherry picked from commit f4247c7c144cd199d8435ba78b3f3f11ffaf70ac)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/23/390523/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix a has been deprecated api

"operatorPrecedence" has been deprecated, and it will be dropped
in a future release.(from:
http://pythonhosted.org/pyparsing/pyparsing-module.html#operatorPrecedence)

Change-Id: I77bc4969cdb7a616c33d11aef27819461f9064c4

commit_message:
Add "batch delete resource client"

example:
input:
  gnocchi resource batch delete
  "id in [239d7f33-984e-5dee-8550-a4ed32a632f0,
  078aad64-2b7a-50ba-93d8-2fedd62b46e6,
  bdaaeec7-3307-52cd-90d4-bfb8c97eb45d]"
  --type instance
output:
  +---------+-------+
| Field   | Value |
+---------+-------+
| deleted | 0     |
+---------+-------+

Change-Id: I3718e4990e306be723f8c888430ff28232a695ea
Closes-Bug: #1585262

commit_message:
Fix metadata property of Senlin node resource

This patch fixes metadata property of Senlin node resource.
The corresponding field name in response body is 'metadata'
rather than 'tags'.

Change-Id: I123421d1b66b90ec6eed8fe987220b7e5b7b2618

Remove deprecated ansible_ssh_host variable

This changes 'ansible_ssh_host' to 'ansible_host'. The 'ansible_ssh_host'
variable has been deprecated as noted here: [0].

[0] - http://docs.ansible.com/ansible/intro_inventory.html#hosts-and-groups

Change-Id: I7f405b30a90b2671ff01b49747ad9f3a9486445a
Related-Bug: #1636606
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Set enable_fernet_setup to false

Upstream patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/389322/
sets enable_fernet_setup to true by default,
and currently in Fuel fernet keys are generated on master,
in order to unblock upstream this commit explicitly sets
enable_fernet_setup to false.

Change-Id: I4e7cbbe893da77c4f83df7f661708b2ad6e8d25b
Closes-Bug: #1635549
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/05/390205/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix errors due to repo_service_user_name setting

Changing the paths of nginx logs to not rely on the
 user name of repo service. This is because nginx related
 configurations, playbooks assume nginx in the directory names.

Change-Id: I458293c687c1857e7d8451a200173bec554d9559
Closes-Bug: #1633739
(cherry picked from commit 31c89372716d9165fe02c723a365ed318b572998)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-repo_server refs/changes/22/390522/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Adding keystoneauth sessions support

This patch allows authentication in swiftclient with a keystonauth
session.

Co-Authored-By: Tim Burke <tim@swiftstack.com>

Change-Id: Ia3fd947ff619c11ff0ce474897533dcf7b49d9b3
Closes-Bug: 1518938

commit_message:
delete list_all_container_objects in the container_client

list_all_container_objects is not a real client method but more of an helper.
We can use list_container_contents replace it.  Therefore, I remove it.

Change-Id: I680868712461ab44c343b82fd007e6e9ea8d746b
Co-Authored-By: guo yunxian <yunxian.guo@easystack.cn>

commit_message:
Failed to delete ocf resources via delete_resources option

Now the charm is using 'crm -w -F resource stop <RES>'
and 'crm -w -F configure delete <RES>' to delete legacy ocf
resource via delete_resources option, but the 'stop' step will
fail when ocf file no longer exists (e.g. due to packages no
longer being available after upgrade). In addition, the daemon
process may still be running after the upgrade in this case.

Change-Id: I7fdac7894366a88a154da5a0510acc535ee776d8
Closes-Bug: #1631858

subject: Postpone rendering tempest.conf till action
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-13 11:15:01.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/charm-tempest/commit/b3fdb8311f08ec13549aa2dcdf7ebea999ef5d47', 'message': 'Ignore Keystone errors as KS may be initialising

The tempest charm queries keystone as it comes up. If this is a fresh
deploy then keystone may be unavailable when tempest performs the
query and rendering tempest.conf will fail.

The tempest.conf is re-rendered when the run-tempest action is
triggered so it is safe to ignore the keystone svc query errors.

Change-Id: Id7dc3b5e36dd98b53a1e438d5b805d6775a996e6
Closes-Bug: 1633044
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-10-17 09:44:32.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/charm-tempest/commit/3e98cbe5c0a817dc4d376735a9c8f75d8706d978', 'message': 'Ignore Keystone errors as KS may be initialising

The tempest charm queries keystone as it comes up. If this is a fresh
deploy then keystone may be unavailable when tempest performs the
query and rendering tempest.conf will fail.

The tempest.conf is re-rendered when the run-tempest action is
triggered so it is safe to ignore the keystone svc query errors.

Change-Id: Id7dc3b5e36dd98b53a1e438d5b805d6775a996e6
Closes-Bug: 1633044

commit_message:
Postpone rendering tempest.conf till action

The tempest charm queries keystone as it comes up. If this is a fresh
deploy then keystone may be unavailable when tempest performs the
query and rendering tempest.conf will fail.

The tempest.conf is re-rendered when the run-tempest action is
triggered so it does not need to be rendered until then.

Change-Id: Id7dc3b5e36dd98b53a1e438d5b805d6775a996e6
Closes-Bug: 1633044

commit_message:
replace filter() to meet python3

As mentioned in link[1], we need use [x for x in data if test(x)] to
repace filter(lambda x : test(x),data) on python3

[1]https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3

Change-Id: I9489c3d34413877f52e7996f5b98e6302e2b36fc

commit_message:
Removes remaining Hyper-V plugin

The Hyper-V Neutron plugin was fully decomposed from neutron
and moved into the networking-hyperv project.

The only thing that remained was a debtcollector move for the
HyperVSecurityGroupsDriver, in order to prevent deployments from
breaking when upgrading to Mitaka or Newton from older versions.

Co-Authored-By: Gary Kotton <gkotton@vmware.com>

Change-Id: Iddc14fc4c52ba1a851e79bcd4cf4f09c63b52312

commit_message:
Revert "Enable neutron to work in a multi node setup" partly

This reverts a part of commit 88f8558d874072536e7660a233f24207a7089651
because it was wrong.  A better fix will follow.

The configuration in question uses the new lib/neutron. (not neutron-legacy)
In that case, calling create_neutron_initial_network from stack.sh directly
is a wrong way, as create_neutron_initial_network is sourced by
neutron-legacy.  The new neutron code should not rely on the legacy one.

Change-Id: Ib73f5a88c5a00d6748e10641a6b5abed16967cc3

commit_message:
Fix response code for invalid requests

If in body of POST, PUT or PATCH requests there is
invalid json Sahara API reply with
500 "Internal Server Error" insted of
400 "Bad Request". In this commit I fix error code
and add error message to response.

Change-Id: I7ccf27e60c72e47e085690017e7eb19213930fdd
Closes-bug: #1632705

subject: Use custom CA cert with tripleo-ansible-inventory
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-25 14:26:07.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/tripleo-ansible-inventory'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-validations/commit/622454b86c898318e4def70467006e7159fecfbd', 'message': 'Use custom CA cert with tripleo-ansible-inventory

When using SSL undercloud and internal certificate authority,
tripleo-ansible-inventory cannot retrieve the host list.

Add the --cacert option and default it to the OS_CACERT environment
variabled to make the listing successful.

The variable name is the conventional one used by all the clients, see:
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/SecureClientConnections

Change-Id: Id77e410abbf797b39bf6e19ad26e8d0e44f8555c
'}]
commit_message:
Use custom CA cert with tripleo-ansible-inventory

When using SSL undercloud and internal certificate authority,
tripleo-ansible-inventory cannot retrieve the host list.

Add the --cacert option and default it to the OS_CACERT environment
variabled to make the listing successful.

The variable name is the conventional one used by all the clients, see:
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/SecureClientConnections

Change-Id: Id77e410abbf797b39bf6e19ad26e8d0e44f8555c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-validations refs/changes/73/390573/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Modify unit test case test_list_image_sorted

Currently test_list_image_sorted is using NameGenerator
class to generate image name in loop. NameGenerator may
generate duplicate names in the loop which may cause failure
of the test case, this patch fixes that by giving predefined names
instead of names generated at runtime.

Closes-Bug: #1636117
Change-Id: I8d550aa74d587905e4ef4d3be21138e35aec0909

commit_message:
Remove unused method validate_docker_memory

Method validate_docker_memory is not used, and
it is referring metod get_docker_quanity, which
itself is no there in source code. Memory validation
is done in MemoryType class. So i think
validate_docker_memory is not required anymore.

Change-Id: I97588c4b0fcb606053cd55657366566b63c38e9c

commit_message:
Copy test.attr to tempest.lib

The attr decorator is used in several tempest plugins.
It doesn't have any dependency and complexity so we can
simply move it to lib.decorators.

Change-Id: Ib47d362778b3b5b752b87e75f024ca26c5bdee42

fix image-register action in cluster-guide page

redirects to the index page other than staying in cluster-guide page.
This patch fixes related issue.

commit_message:
Drop MANIFEST.in - it's not needed by pbr

training-labs already uses PBR:-
setuptools.setup(
    setup_requires=['pbr>'],
    pbr=True)

commit_message:
cluster action whether check size limitation

Currentlly, node_leave and node_join action will check
the size limitation before executing. However, kinds of
cluster actions may not need the check. Add a parameter
to control whether to check.

This patch focuses on cluster action handler layer.

Change-Id: I459174e3e7b6857942714cbad0da8c6872627d9d

commit_message:
Adjust clouds being used in nodepool

Reduce osic maxservers to 0 and add datacentred, city cloud and enter
cloud suite quotas in order to encourage load to these new clouds for
demonstration.

Change-Id: I600137d06808000ec4617990bd0420ec3253b34f

demonstration.

commit_message:
[networking] Correct the fwaas_v2 driver configration.

This patch correct the fwaas_v2 for l3_agent from iptables
to iptables_v2 driver.

Change-Id: I40e4a157002da861563dcdd1e3fb3c01f7d67438
Closes-Bug: #1635092

commit_message:
Change "Openstack" to "OpenStack"

According to the word choice convention in
http://docs.openstack.org/contributor-guide/writing-style/word-choice.html
We should use OpenStack instead of Openstack.

Change-Id: I62e810dc9de180297905ee8ebdeb2b06df9b6b66

commit_message:
Add the missing file for Newton on 32-bit VMs

This patch adds support for 32-bit Ubuntu 16.04 LTS which is needed for
building a Newton cluster on that architecture.

Change-Id: Ib78c8b632685b2794fe0bd18a08b97d0f9607ce3

subject: Prevent host_id updates on trunk subports
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-25 22:52:43.000000000', 'files': ['etc/policy.json'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/28bbd448a8036e5801b141d647016390db548cc5', 'message': 'Prevent host_id updates on trunk subports

When using the trunk feature a user is required to boot VMs off a
trunk parent port. If a user erroneously attempts to use a subport
instead, no failure is reported and the outcome in terms of data
plane wiring is undetermined.

This patch changes our policy to prevent updates of the host ID
(what nova does when it boots off a port) from occurring when
the port is a subport (device_owner == trunk:subport). The trunk
feature itself relies on being able to update subport bindings,
but that occurs using the plugin API, which is not subject to
policy enforcement.

Change-Id: Ib2432ed7851e9aea86fe714a02f9922d3c7804f0
Closes-bug: #1636485
'}]
commit_message:
Prevent host_id updates on trunk subports

When using the trunk feature a user is required to boot VMs off a
trunk parent port. If a user erroneously attempts to use a subport
instead, no failure is reported and the outcome in terms of data
plane wiring is undetermined.

This patch changes our policy to prevent updates of the host ID
(what nova does when it boots off a port) from occurring when
the port is a subport (device_owner == trunk:subport). The trunk
feature itself relies on being able to update subport bindings,
but that occurs using the plugin API, which is not subject to
policy enforcement.

Change-Id: Ib2432ed7851e9aea86fe714a02f9922d3c7804f0
Closes-bug: #1636485
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/79/390679/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add release notes for the master branch

1. What is the problem?
There is no release notes in master branch, then the user of
Tricircle don't know what features supported, what features not
supported.
2. What is the solution to the problem?
Add release notes to outline what features supported for the Tricircle
project.
3. What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle to realize the solution?
No new features.

Change-Id: I4270730bd5def464b9814f7b457a0316a6dd1a0e

commit_message:
[glossary] Consolidate project codenames [glance]

- Combine "Image service" entry with "glance" entry
  - Rename "Image service" to "Image service (glance)"
  - Link "glance" to "Image service (glance)"
  - Make sure description matches project.yaml
- Remove the duplicate entry Image API, keep Image server API
  - Link "Glance API server" to "Image API"
- Combine Image registry entry with "glance registry"

Change-Id: I37cc324cf6783d13a4bcefb8cb1e8043d4732365
Implements: bp improve-glossary-usage

commit_message:
Add a modulo core constraint

A modulo constraint will be used to restrict numeric values to
leave a certain remainder when divided with certain divisor.
E.g. we can use this to constrain values to even/odd numbers.

Change-Id: I9d7db4307be2a2b93cc928cf5912af7b49c72076

commit_message:
Use upper-constraints for tox envs

Pin tox environments to upper-constraints to avoid conflicts with
library releases.

Change-Id: Iffa0b9a34b13fe497c8e71656a3659ecf973c60f

commit_message:
Keystone::Region observe reality implementation

Add override parse_live_resource_data method implementation for
OS::Keystone::Region resource.

Also, translation rule resolve has been added for parent_region
property.

subject: Make shell main() specify return value in exit code
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-26 09:25:04.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometerclient/shell.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-ceilometerclient/commit/7985f1fd9fc85ae41e074132b238545cc67d9e93', 'message': 'Make shell main() specify return value in exit code

sys.exit() calls in main() will make the interactive
python interpreter exit. We can call the main() as
below to avoid to exit the interactive interpreter,
and specify the return value of main() in the exit
code at the same time.

sys.exit(main())

Change-Id: I0d9cf4417c3af047af5ef22e1bf07266235bd5a5
'}]
commit_message:
Make shell main() specify return value in exit code

sys.exit() calls in main() will make the interactive
python interpreter exit. We can call the main() as
below to avoid to exit the interactive interpreter,
and specify the return value of main() in the exit
code at the same time.

sys.exit(main())

Change-Id: I0d9cf4417c3af047af5ef22e1bf07266235bd5a5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-ceilometerclient refs/changes/28/361028/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
python3: Repalce the six.iteritems with items()

In py3: we avoid using six.iteritems/keys achieve iterators.
we can use dict.items/keys instead, as it will return iterators
in py3 as well, alao dict.items/keys vill more readable.

Here two links for more details,
[1] introduce the progress of python 3 effort porting for openstack
    https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] a discussion suggesting to avoid six , thanks Robert Collins
    http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: I82a1ef7778ab353ae5263a48ee5acf9df80d1dfe

subject: Remove snapshot/replication_support configs of huawei driver
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-25 07:46:22.000000000', 'files': ['manila/share/drivers/huawei/v3/connection.py', 'manila/share/drivers/huawei/huawei_nas.py', 'manila/tests/share/drivers/huawei/test_huawei_nas.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/manila/commit/5380d89964bc57ed1619357bb2f23af7e0754f79', 'message': "Remove snapshot/replication_support configs of huawei driver

Currently, huawei driver uses snapshot_support&replication_support
configurations to tell if a backend supports snapshot and replication,
and a backend cannot support both at the same time because huawei
driver doesn't support snapshot replication.

However, this not supporting both thing applies great usage limitation
to huawei driver, it's not flexible for users.

This patch removes these configurations, and huawei driver reports
supporting snapshot and replication both to scheduler.

Change-Id: I122fb4c76db0f48b4974d2d08c41214ac049a6d2
"}]
commit_message:
Remove snapshot/replication_support configs of huawei driver

Currently, huawei driver uses snapshot_support&replication_support
configurations to tell if a backend supports snapshot and replication,
and a backend cannot support both at the same time because huawei
driver doesn't support snapshot replication.

However, this not supporting both thing applies great usage limitation
to huawei driver, it's not flexible for users.

This patch removes these configurations, and huawei driver reports
supporting snapshot and replication both to scheduler.

Change-Id: I122fb4c76db0f48b4974d2d08c41214ac049a6d2

commit_message:
Fixed errors while generating releasenotes

*Extension error:
Could not import extension oslosphinx
(exception: No module named oslosphinx)
*Extension error:
Could not import extension reno.sphinxtest
(exception: No module named sphinxtest)
*Warning, treated as error:
/home/python-mistralclient/releasenotes/source/index.rst:7:
WARNING: toctree contains reference to nonexisting document
u'Indices and tables' Also correct the mistralclient version details.

Change-Id: Icabd8a2a4876786abbad35e55f0d59ad94651d85
Closes-Bug: #1634809

Add Python 3.5 classifier and venv

Now that there is a passing gate job, we can claim
support for Python 3.5 in the classifier.
This patch also adds the convenience py35 venv.

commit_message:
Switch hacking.checks from neutron to neutron_lib

Per armax recommendation in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/374425/,
moving away from the neutron hacking checks, using neutron_lib hacking
checks instead.

We need to bypass N530 (direct neutron imports not allowed) for the
forseeable future.

Change-Id: I05804844445575a55ab33273b88fd3a5ff9df179
Closes-Bug: #1626298

Add Secure Boot options to extra flavor sepc and image property docs

Adding os:secure_boot and possible values to extra flavor spec docs
and adding additional details for os_secure_boot property for
Hyper-V to image metadata property docs.

subject: FIP6: Support creating IPv6 FIP
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-25 18:16:44.000000000', 'files': ['midonet/neutron/db/l3_db_midonet.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-midonet/commit/1697542d59f8e3c3381db57423cc46efdd708ac9', 'message': 'FIP6: Support creating IPv6 FIP

This modifies l3_db_midonet to override the _create_floatingip
method in order to allow the creation of floating IPs with IPv6
addresses. The patch also fixes a bug in the overriden method
where if creating the floating IP will fail after creating the
port, the port was not deleted.

Ref: MI-1603

Change-Id: Ia852002aaad32e5c91c45ecf5f93a8c0c432c1b7
Signed-off-by: Alex Bikfalvi <alex.bikfalvi@midokura.com>
'}]
commit_message:
FIP6: Support creating IPv6 FIP

This modifies l3_db_midonet to override the _create_floatingip
method in order to allow the creation of floating IPs with IPv6
addresses. The patch also fixes a bug in the overriden method
where if creating the floating IP will fail after creating the
port, the port was not deleted.

Ref: MI-1603

Change-Id: Ia852002aaad32e5c91c45ecf5f93a8c0c432c1b7
Signed-off-by: Alex Bikfalvi <alex.bikfalvi@midokura.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-midonet refs/changes/27/390627/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Implement mechanism for plugin node attributes

Provide ability for plugins to add additional attributes for nodes.
* Added new NodeAttributesDefaultsHandler handler for getting
  default node attributes.
* Added code stuff for getting and updating additional plugin
  node attributes.
* Added code stuff to serialize plugin node attributes for
  orchestrator.

Change-Id: I5c6d6f3c815a034683e624b98fa1f360ab4b491c
Implements: blueprint nics-and-nodes-attributes-via-plugin

commit_message:
Loading payload from remote URI

POC on loading payloads using remote URI. This is part of a larger
effort in packaging syntribos to ensure that the project would
work without much configuration post install from pypi.

commit_message:

commit_message:
Removes logic dependent on 'odl_on_controller'

Since moving to composable service/roles there was some logic here that
was relying on a variable to enable ODL rather than enabling the service
itself to decide where ODL was enabled.  Now that ODL and ODL OVS
configuration are split into 2 different services we can make these
truly composable.

Partial-Bug: 1633625

Change-Id: Ia55c05e12d5d434111a13e1ed795da530e3ff4a5
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 4cf346d257611f88a00d30350c3d062fd32cd83e)

commit_message:
VMware: Enable Fault tolerance on VM

This patch adds the ability to enable Fault tolerance (FT) on a VM
within vcenter cluster. On Nova, when instance is launched
with a flavour of extra_spec set as "cap:vmware_fault_tolerance=true".
The VM will be enabled with FT protection from failures of CPU,
network, and storage. The failed vm will be automatically recovered
with well kept runtime context.

DocImpact: Enabling FT will need to allocate additional resource.
The secondary vm will be automatically scheduled inside the same VC
cluster as the primary vm instead of another hypervisor.

Implements: blueprint vmware-enable-ft

Change-Id: I4edd7603ca3f0234b11008d53b02508b4f5d94ca

subject: VMware: prevent volume deletion if volume in instance folder
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-18 12:36:53.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/3b0edec411eb5ad12ecbc9184a749cc74e6a4854', 'message': "VMware: prevent volume deletion if volume in instance folder

If the instance is migrated (manual or SDRS) with an attached volume,
the volume's vmdk will end up in instance's datastore folder. The patch
ensures that the volume will be returned to its original datastore and
folder when it is detached.

Commit 901d61980dc8136b9393d80659b638e3eb6cddb4 ensured tha the volume
was detached prior to deleting the instance (in the event that the
instance had an attached volume)

Change-Id: I3356e39f019d411eb789358f11e1e9ede631659b
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-06-18 13:03:13.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/d12aecde92a7a7f57f84a007e8c46f1d0a0a5bd6', 'message': "VMware: prevent volume deletion if volume in instance folder

If the instance is migrated (manual or SDRS) with an attached volume,
the volume's vmdk will end up in instance's datastore folder. The patch
ensures that the volume will be returned to its original datastore and
folder when it is detached.

Commit 901d61980dc8136b9393d80659b638e3eb6cddb4 ensured tha the volume
was detached prior to deleting the instance (in the event that the
instance had an attached volume)

commit_message:
VMware: prevent volume deletion if volume in instance folder

If the instance is migrated (manual or SDRS) with an attached volume,
the volume's vmdk will end up in instance's datastore folder. The patch
ensures that the volume will be returned to its original datastore and
folder when it is detached.

Commit 901d61980dc8136b9393d80659b638e3eb6cddb4 ensured that the volume
was detached prior to deleting the instance (in the event that the
instance had an attached volume)

Closes-bug: #1428645

Change-Id: I3356e39f019d411eb789358f11e1e9ede631659b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/03/193103/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: <VMWare> Attach/detach more than one SCSI LUN
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-02 09:29:41.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/5e7fc3302911a400ec865f233ab64a0ed4db9263', 'message': 'Enable VMWare driver to attach one more SCSI LUN to VM.

When we attach a SCSI volume to VMWare instance, the first LUN is
always chosen. That is to say, we could succeed to attach the
first SCSI volume, but we will fail to attach the second SCSI
volume, because the second SCSI volume is trying to use the first
LUN, which is already used by the first SCSI volume.

The reason of this trouble is that the code match the LUN based on
only the name prefix "host.ScsiDisk" in the LUN name, but not
based on the LUN number. Because all the LUNs has the same name
prefix, the first LUN is always chosen, but never the other ones.

This change will add the LUN number as the matching condition, so
that the right LUN could be chosen.

Change-Id: I036278b20d81b1be86594dc400c5d498bc172e8b

commit_message:
<VMWare> Attach/detach more than one SCSI LUN

There are 2 problems fixed in this change:

(1) When we attach a SCSI volume to VMWare instance, the first
LUN is always chosen. That is to say, we could succeed to attach
the first SCSI volume, but we will fail to attach the second SCSI
volume, because the second SCSI volume is trying to use the first
LUN, which is already used by the first SCSI volume.

The reason of this trouble is that the code match the LUN based on
only the name prefix "host.ScsiDisk" in the LUN name, but not
based on the LUN number. Because all the LUNs has the same name
prefix, the first LUN is always chosen, but never the other ones.

This change will add the LUN number as the matching condition, so
that the right LUN could be chosen.

(2) Another problem is, when we detaching more than one iSCSI
volume, the first volume could be detached, but the second one
will fail, because the driver could not get the iSCSI target
after detaching the first volume without any rescan operation.

So this change will let detach scsci method _detach_volume_iscsi
use _iscsi_discover_target instead of _iscsi_get_target for scsi
target discovery, because the former one has a rescan operation
before discovering target.

Closes-Bug: #1373054
Change-Id: I036278b20d81b1be86594dc400c5d498bc172e8b

commit_message:
Rectification in securityGroup API doc file name

os-security-group contains different api request samples.
One file for creating security group was not properly named.
This patchset updates that file name.

Change-Id: Id201f35ec12811734a6af81d65746f505fd64096

subject: Only return latest fault of each instance in db api
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-15 03:54:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/3327e4c8677a8886983f37f0e2a118beb1a6d9f3', 'message': 'Only return latest fault of each instance in db api

instance_fault_get_by_instance_uuids() return all the faults
of each instance in db api, but the major part of faults are
useless except the latest one. In order to avoid useless loop
in fill_faults() and _make_instance_list() of instance object
when we make the instance list, modify the db api, only return
the latest fault for each instance.

Change-Id: I8e6885a31dcf2d48c7c3af531f7cd05e88e2c034
Closes-Bug: #1495400

commit_message:
Only return latest fault of each instance in db api

instance_fault_get_by_instance_uuids() return all the faults
of each instance in db api, but the major part of faults are
useless except the latest one. In order to avoid useless loop
in fill_faults() and _make_instance_list() of instance object
when we make the instance list, modify the db api, only return
the latest fault for each instance.

Closes-Bug: #1495400

Change-Id: I8e6885a31dcf2d48c7c3af531f7cd05e88e2c034

commit_message:
WIP:  Migrate LVM code to using os-brick

This is a WIP

The purpose of this patch is to work on remove most of the lvm code in Nova
and use the os-brick code.

A related/required os-brick patch is here:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/308054/
Depends-On: I39e7e6ddc9bd9951fa10017025e5110fa705ee0f

subject: initial commit Neutron validates security-group names regardless of case, however they would fail when the scheduler would attempt to allocate the group to the instance causing it to enter into an ERROR state. This patch helps in resolving this issue by raising exception when duplicate security group name is provided while booting VM. Now VM instead of going into error state, shows exception to user saying security group not found.

commit_message:
initial commit
Neutron validates security-group names regardless of case,
however they would fail when the scheduler would attempt to allocate the
group to the instance causing it to enter into an ERROR state. This patch
helps in resolving this issue by raising exception when duplicate security
group name is provided while booting VM. Now VM instead of going into
error state, shows exception to user saying security group not found.

Change-Id: Ibb0afdf668e3f01990553a96fcb3df0305eac8a4
Closes-Bug: #1289195

commit_message:
xenapi: rename dest_check_data to migrate_data

To stop some confusion in VMops, lets always call migrate_data,
migrate_data, and not sometimes call it dest_check_data, that used to be
different to migrate_data.

This also removes the logic that converts dicts to migrate_data objects,
as this work is now done in the compute manager. This includes updating
some unit tests that still sent dicts to the new method.

Change-Id: I23939ad3091e49b9fd26efc535a9fc76e06b0582

commit_message:
Added a sample file for Add Floating IP request action.

Currently, the floating-ips-create-resp.json is used as the
request sample for Add (Associate) Floating Ip (Addfloatingip Action)
in the servers-actions.inc file. According to TODO, a new request
sample file must be created for this action.

Change-Id: I9d7deebd3d61779b53fa1ca9d58a2aa187691e85
Closes-Bug: #1582099

commit_message:
Implement state machine for migration.

This patch abstracts live migration state machine from
the old mixed migration status code.

Change-Id: Iea58866feabb74556bf6c4f2bc638f76fcc72b1d
Partially-Implements: blueprint migration-state-machine

commit_message:
xenapi: Support bare VHD image

Currently only VHD chains in a tarball are supported. If we have a
single VHD file, we should be able to upload it as-is.

Implements: blueprint bare-vhd-image
Change-Id: I08ff2a96b827b2ee359390df42af063114b7fff6

commit_message:
Stop using mox stubs in test_disk_config.py

Replace 'stubs.Set' with 'stub_out' in
nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/test_disk_config.py

Part of blueprint remove-mox-newton

Change-Id: I9746e2ce04107a030b1e54711b6dc79e1b0455ac

commit_message:
Add mock for some libvirt unit tests work on ppc64le architecture

These two tests are failing on ppc64le architecture:
nova.tests.unit.virt.libvirt.test_driver.LibvirtConnTestCase.test_lifecycle
_event_registration
nova.tests.unit.virt.test_virt_drivers.LibvirtConnTestCase.test_init_host
Because Libvirt in non-intel architectures has higher version, so fakelibvirt
version cannot be used.

Change-Id: I68aa519c7adad2eab5b1470d1efa6875dce61303

commit_message:
Adds ResourceTracker host capabilities update

Sets the host_capabilities field in the compute_node
object when the nova-compute service starts.

Partially-Implements: blueprint expose-host-capabilities

Change-Id: I3768ae5ccda8ce8cab2e0078c8837c60c9c8183d

object: Adds host_capabilities in ComputeNode model

Adds host_capabilities field in the ComputeNode object model.

Partially implements: blueprint expose-host-capabilities

Change-Id: Ic9ba044a12950af4823612ba9aadf91587e2feae

commit_message:
driver: Adds get_host_capabilities method

The get_host_capabilities will return a HostCapabilities object
that contains the host's capabilities and all of the driver's hypervisor
specific capabilities that can be determined by the implementing driver.

DocImpact

Partially-Implements: blueprint expose-host-capabilities

Change-Id: I5d95277902c42e237ec6950f1dd4686e1cb5f3a3

commit_message:
db: Adds host_capabilities column in compute_nodes

Adds the host_capabilities column in the compute_nodes table.
The column will contain a JSON dump of the compute node's
reported host capabilities / features.

Partially-Implements: blueprint expose-host-capabilities

Change-Id: I5ac69c0751ef256c9fa40b69f997a366e9dafb1c

commit_message:
Adds host capabilities related object models

Adds HostCapabilities object model.
Adds HyperVHostCapabilities object model.

Adds supported_instances, which represents a given host's supported
instances.

Partially implements: blueprint expose-host-capabilities

Change-Id: Ib93076de06bd7945fb0599f8020257d00b10411a

commit_message:
Adds host capabilities related fields and dependencies

Adds OptionalFeature, HyperVMachineType, HyperVRemoteFXResolution,
HyperVRemoteFXVram enums.

Adds CapabilityDependency, which represents a dependency between
the capabilities "A" and "B" and their possible values.

Adds Capability, OptionalCapability, ListSingleCapability, and
AggregateCapability classes and fields, containing the 'satisfies'
method, which can determine whether the capability field can satisfy
a given requirement.

Partially implements: blueprint expose-host-capabilities

Change-Id: I062322a6d079e51c5a755c900a53d564ee362c6a

subject: VMware: vm placement on group of hosts within cluster
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-09 10:20:48.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/ce5538fd0fd4634aa5df903660cd0ab8e079f0d6', 'message': "WIP: VMware: leverage vm group placement in DRS cluster

DRS in vSphere exposes ability to define placement
for VM groups based on affinity and anti-affinity rules.
http://tinyurl.com/p7ctnp8

This patch adds ability to do placement for a group of
instances on specific set of host(s) by leveraging DRS.

vSphere admin can create vm group, host group and define
rules for placement between vm and host groups.

On nova, when an image is created with property 'vmware_vm_group'
matching the vm group in vsphere cluster, then this patch
takes care of adding all instances to vm group before power on.

When the instance is powered on, then DRS will do the placement
based on policy defined in vsphere.

DocImpact

Change-Id: Ifde55d3016b3178b0e4c80ea99a9471f9223c87f

commit_message:
VMware: vm placement on group of hosts within cluster

This patch adds ability to do placement of instances
on specific group of hosts within vcenter cluster.

vSphere admin can create DRS vm group [1], host group and define
rules for placement between vm and host groups.

On Nova, when instance is launched with flavor
extra spec 'vmware:vm_group' matching the vm group in vsphere
cluster, then this patch takes care of adding all instances to
DRS vm group before power on.

When the instance is powered on, then DRS will do the placement
based on policy defined in vsphere.

[1] http://tinyurl.com/p7ctnp8

Implements: blueprint vmware-placement-policy
DocImpact
Change-Id: Ifde55d3016b3178b0e4c80ea99a9471f9223c87f

commit_message:
Add async reponse code to evacuate

Evacuate is essentially asynchronous activity, so
it should return 202 response code in case of success
instead of synchronous 200 code.

Change-Id: Iadf3921f761ef00b5949ea9e94fb8142180e98ed
Depends-on: I2c081878c18f2905a9509cfdbc84deec32127154

subject: VMware: affinity and anti-affinity within cluster
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-09 10:20:48.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/e9c1b0a515f18b10b383f359cb6c0e094396fca9', 'message': 'WIP: VMware: add ability to set affinity/anti-affinity within cluster

VMware nova driver currently exposes a cluster in vcenter
as a compute node.

Since a cluster can have many ESX hosts, the existing filters
does not guarantee the placement policy has the ESX host level.

The affinity and anti-affinity rules can be guaranteed at
host level by
- ServerGroupAffinityFilter and ServerGroupAntiAffinityFilter
- server group api extension
- leveraging DRS (http://tinyurl.com/qfyc6t8)

This patch inspects instance group object
and retrieves affinity/anti-affinity policies. Then, the cluster
is reconfigured with DRS affinity rules such that the server group
policies are honored within cluster.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I5ea5ced07b11d9c1cfc0e78299cbebebd80a5968
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-11-04 08:48:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/c7a1f8a1468b01b77834e0b18f63d4ed94ae0500', 'message': 'VMware: affinity and anti-affinity within cluster

- leveraging DRS rules [1]

commit_message:
VMware: affinity and anti-affinity within cluster

VMware nova driver currently exposes a cluster in vcenter
as a compute node.

Since a cluster can have many ESX hosts, the existing filters
does not guarantee the placement policy has the ESX host level.

The affinity and anti-affinity rules can be guaranteed at
host level by leveraging
- ServerGroupAffinityFilter and ServerGroupAntiAffinityFilter
- leveraging DRS rules [1]

This patch inspects instance group object
and retrieves affinity/anti-affinity policies. Then, the cluster
is reconfigured with DRS affinity rules such that the server group
policies are honored within cluster.

[1] http://tinyurl.com/qfyc6t8

Implements: blueprint vmware-placement-policy
DocImpact

Change-Id: I5ea5ced07b11d9c1cfc0e78299cbebebd80a5968
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/13/210813/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

revisions:

This change exposes flavor extra_spec 'vmware:vm_group'
that allows admin to specify DRS group to which
the instances should be associated.

commit_message:
VMware: add flavor extra_spec for vm group

This change exposes flavor extra_spec 'vmware:vm_group'
that allows admin to specify DRS group to which
the instances should be associated.

Implements: blueprint vmware-placement-policy
DocImpact

Change-Id: Ic217b52c7eb7567be97ca71b78862b54faadfbf8

commit_message:
Tolerate the failure to get some instances' information

Ironic will fail sometimes to clear the node's instance_uuid
even when the instance is deleted on the nova side. The patch
makes the ironic virt driver more tolerant in this case.
Instead of rasing exception, it will LOG warning the failed
instances.

Closes-bug: #1586470
Change-Id: I4a53f8da3323dd02858300ecd6fe0d977e7415f6

commit_message:
Fixes invalid uuid usages in functional tests

oslo_versionedobjects.fields.UUIDField will validate UUID in next major
release. So need fix invalid uuid usage before moving to new major
release of oslo.versionedobjects.

Change-Id: I1e669e0c811807063f276ac242b47f65fd87b8e4
Partial-Bug: #1557378

commit_message:
Make clear aggregate's AZs are a comma separated string

Add a test case to make sure AZ filter is using a set 'in'
comparing.

commit_message:
<VMWARE> Add power state cache in compute manager

When initing host and syncing power state, VMWare driver has to
fetch the instance power state one by one. If there are thousands
instances in vCenter, it will be time exhausting, and will bring
heavy network burden. To reduce time and network bandwidth, this
change adds a power state cache for host init and for every
power state syncing process.

This change also works with other hypervisor driver, even though
they do not implements the new function.

Closes-Bug: #1513735

Change-Id: Iddd8315cd78b99d96818d514ad0d882d57edf2dd

There is a dummy contents of dhcp conf file during shelving instance.

All contents in the original compute node should be released because

instance to be unshelved into the other compute node.

dummy mac address in the dhcp conf file is remained.

Therefore, this dummy dhcp mac address should be deleted during shelving instance work flow.

commit_message:
Removing dummy mac address in the dhcp conf during shelving

There is a dummy contents of dhcp conf file during shelving instance.
All contents in the original compute node should be released because
instance to be unshelved onto another compute node.

For using nova-network environment, however,
dummy mac address in the dhcp conf file remains.
Therefore, this dummy dhcp mac address should be deleted
during shelving instance work flow.

Co-Authored-By: Joe Gordon <joe.gordon0@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Ibc36033700d11489014fb23d9f82e02e9ed804b8
Closes-Bug: #1290635

commit_message:
make sure BDM is deleted for instance without host

if an instance was booted from volume and failed before host is set then
it's block device mapping is not deleted on delete operation.

Closes-bug: #1583999
Change-Id: I742d77af682eae0e92466de2f1233b3a13de8af7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/25/319725/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-19 15:13:08.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/c21c5cd8e88b5d8baa6b560cbce1ed588e657cfb', 'message': 'Remove destroy instance which states is "accepted" after evacuate.

Normally, if you finished evacuating instance, nova-compute will
destroy the existed instances whose state are "done" or "accept"
in the migration table from the fault host after the nova-compute
service is restarted. However, if the nova-scheduler failed to

Change-Id: Iac76f849b4c9e5a906cf51ed7de6627f2d24ef41
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-06-12 03:27:23.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/e224994389c6c4b60ca04b134856281649959f2f', 'message': 'Remove destroy instance which states is "accepted" after evacuate.
