commit_message:
Remove destroy instance which states is "accepted" after evacuate.

Normally, if you finished evacuating instance, nova-compute will
destroy the existed instances whose state are "done" or "accept"
in the migration table from the fault host after the nova-compute
service is restarted. However, if the nova-scheduler failed to
schedule the hosts, e.g. no valid host, nova-scheduler won't update
the migration state of the instance to "failed", so that the
nova-compute will destroy this instance after restarting by mistake.

Closes-bug: #1583504

Change-Id: Iac76f849b4c9e5a906cf51ed7de6627f2d24ef41
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/31/318731/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: contrib: Add vif-bridge-nova-network script for Xen
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-13 17:18:33.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/cb7daaab757f5f744dc9c3698e67b451db3392fe', 'message': 'contrib: Add vif-bridge-nova-network script for Xen.

This script adds a vif created for a Xen guest to the bridge. This script
is to be called by the Xen toolstack instead of the default one as the
default will make call to iptables in a way that is not compatible with
nova uses of iptables.

To make use of the script, it is to be placed in XEN_SCRIPT_DIR (likely to
be /etc/xen/scripts) and adds the following in nova.conf:
[libvirt]
xen_vif_bridge_script_path = vif-bridge-nova-network

Change-Id: Ief24f0eff85f9b5a5f8cf26c3e08c4d8aeabc789
Partial-Bug: #1461642
Co-Authored-By: Christian Berendt <berendt@b1-systems.de>
Signed-off-by: Anthony PERARD <anthony.perard@citrix.com>

commit_message:
contrib: Add vif-bridge-nova-network script for Xen

This script adds a vif created for a Xen guest to the bridge. This script
is to be called by the Xen toolstack instead of the default one as the
default will make call to iptables in a way that is not compatible with
nova uses of iptables.

To make use of the script, it is to be placed in XEN_SCRIPT_DIR (likely to
be /etc/xen/scripts) and adds the following in nova.conf:
[libvirt]
xen_vif_bridge_script_path = vif-bridge-nova-network

Change-Id: Ief24f0eff85f9b5a5f8cf26c3e08c4d8aeabc789
Closes-Bug: #1461642
Co-Authored-By: Christian Berendt <berendt@b1-systems.de>
Signed-off-by: Anthony PERARD <anthony.perard@citrix.com>

subject: Stop injecting internal device name and type in network_data.json
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-01 18:34:38.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/netutils.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/ab4c043bd2e70c5730a3f2853da9b7aeb984d123', 'message': 'Stop injecting internal device name and type in network_data.json

Nova currently injects in network_data.json the internal device name
in the link id field and the device "type" in the link type field.
This is wrong and could mislead users about how they should use and
interpret those values.

The nova-specs for network_data.json [1] specifies that:
* the link id should be a "Generic, generated ID".
* the link type should be "vif" if it's a virtual interface and
  "phy" for physical interface.

This change updates the implementation to respect the spirit of the
metadata-service-network-info spec by injecting a generic ID for link id and
'vif' for link type.

Change-Id: I459d7e437561d22ccea7736c872b36256b508267
Closes-bug: #1588017
'}]
commit_message:
Stop injecting internal device name and type in network_data.json

Nova currently injects in network_data.json the internal device name
in the link id field and the device "type" in the link type field.
This is wrong and could mislead users about how they should use and
interpret those values.

The nova-specs for network_data.json [1] specifies that:
* the link id should be a "Generic, generated ID".
* the link type should be "vif" if it's a virtual interface and
  "phy" for physical interface.

This change updates the implementation to respect the spirit of the
metadata-service-network-info spec by injecting a generic ID for link id and
'vif' for link type.

Change-Id: I459d7e437561d22ccea7736c872b36256b508267
Closes-bug: #1588017

commit_message:
libvirt-xen: Add xen_vif_bridge_script_path config option

This config option allow to specify a different script to be runned by the
Xen toolstack than the default one.

A follow up patch needs to add a script into the contrib directory to
fix the bug.

Change-Id: I2ab4525d63deda2a3e47ca5381f4e2c0ee5a79d7
Partial-Bug: #1461642

commit_message:
New field for LibvirtLiveMigrateData

prior to this patch is_shared_block_storage
flag could be set to True for both block
storages and shared file level storage.
This patch introduced new flag for file
level storages like NFS to use.

Change-Id: I47ff780e6f2d048ec1664ff6493d4660c8c604f8

commit_message:
Change scheduling behavior for baremetal instances.

Baremetal node can take only one instance. Is not need to iterate over all
instances in spec and retrieve list of available hosts for each one.
One baremetal instance should be mapped to one baremetal node.

Change-Id: Ied9cf6e0c74cb7878301b5bc2a27a3e596df2378

commit_message:
Py3 do not support "exception, e"

Py3 do not support "exception, e" ,we should correct it
with "exception as e".

Change-Id: I55c0c56e42ec435f4ef9de5026e9b6adcfa5a838

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-02 19:19:33.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/e833c110e3366580da3e9d58fdc177476bcfb706', 'message': 'PoC: Scheduler: Placement using random weights distribution.

attempt to avoid clashes by taking the top N hosts in a list of hosts
sorted by weights and choosing randomly from that subset.

The N variable is adjusted using a configuration variable.
(scheduler_host_subset_size) The issue with this is that the value of N is
not easy to acertain. If it is too small then clashes will occur frequently.
If it is too large then placement will be non-optimal, possibly causing
an uneven distribution of instances.

This change introduces a new method of placing instances. It places
based on a random distribution built using the weights of all available
hosts. This means that although it is possible that an instance could be

commit_message:
PoC: Scheduler: Placement using random weights distribution.

In large deployments where multiple schedulers are used we currently
attempt to avoid clashes by taking the top N hosts in a list of hosts
sorted by weights and choosing randomly from that subset.

The N variable is adjusted using a configuration variable.
(scheduler_host_subset_size) The issue with this is that the value of N is
not easy to acertain. If it is too small then clashes will occur frequently.
If it is too large then placement will be non-optimal, possibly causing
an uneven distribution of instances.

This change introduces a new method of placing instances. It places
based on a random distribution built using the weights of all available
hosts. This means that although it is possible that an instance could be
scheduled to any of the available hosts, hosts with more resources will
be more likely.

Change-Id: Iba1acae4e93fd267a435086659c1b6b358e2f0c0

was not supported to be configurable in the ironic section of nova.conf.

commit_message:
Add ironic 'api_insecure' option to nova.conf

To prevent SSL certificate verification, the 'insecure' option
was not supported to be configurable in the ironic section of nova.conf.
The underlying driver does support the 'insecure' option,
it was just ignored, when configured in nova.conf.
This change allows and reads the 'api_insecure' parameter from the
ironic section, which then will be passed to the underlying driver.

Change-Id: I40b16593e692e578d8ec34f229a622b73bb41067
Closes-Bug: #1504033

commit_message:
WIP - Accept multiple hosts for live migration

The recent change to have the scheduler verify a requested host when
live migrating means that unless the 'force' parameter is set to True
(which is advisable in only certain cases), a live migration request can
be rejected. This may result in several round-trips to the API before a
valid host is found. It would be much more efficient to accept a list of
hosts from which the scheduler can select when there is more than one
potentially acceptable target for the migration.

Blueprint specify-multiple-live-migrate-hosts

Change-Id: Ib467b51afd47d68709a9622d9d85fcc71d97407e

commit_message:
Implementation of Libvirt Storage Pools

This patch contains the code to implement the class responsible
for managing storage pools and volumes and place holders for
new backend disk management.

Change-Id: Ic68107ee10d354224f23db5446ef639962b639cd
Implements: blueprint use-libvirt-storage-pools

commit_message:
Add DeviceTaggingFilter to scheduler

With this patch, if a user attempts to boot a guest with tagged
devices on a virt driver that does not yet support device tagging,
Nova will refuse to run the VM

Change-Id: Ice6f641ff6d082dfbf49c3de0e1f001ff72accdb
Implements: blueprint virt-device-role-tagging
Depends-on: I0ed581da4c22670dd87959959d91c564e694bd51

commit_message:
Notifications: single source schema

Generate a simple schema from the payload fields, assuming a single
data source. Update the ServiceStatusPayload to provide its schema
this way.

Reading Ib400aa6f417f33eda4c84d0b7946a64ee5013318 I noticed that
SCHEMA seemed redundant with 'fields'. Checking the code, I found
only one use of SCHEMA so far which was also redundant with 'fields'.
So here is a patch to remove that redundancy, while allowing for
flexibility if required.

I haven't included a unit test for the new method because
ServiceStatusPayload uses the new method and that notification is
tested, so we already have coverage.

Change-Id: Ia4fb4dd004f0f0fe0006852e2411ddcb2bb84fd4

commit_message:
xenapi: soft reboot should attempt hard reboot on failure

When we issue a soft reboot, there are ways it can fail, such as:
* if the guest has crashed, it will fail
* if the PV drivers are unresponsive / not present

Consistent with what libvirt does, we can retry with a hard reboot.

Change-Id: Iaca1f241cd9db52f5af0df51e5addc97d838c1a6
Closes-Bug: 1422342

subject: WIP: Make allocate_for_instance skip create option
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-22 09:41:09.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/4ba50653c82dec2e281a2dbe2437252c1b280dd7', 'message': 'WIP: Make allocate_for_instance skip create option

Once we pull out the port create and valid into a separate method, we
can call this from a different location. For backwards compatibility we
need to make sure we optionally skip the port create, if its not already
been done.

We need some prep work:
* finish port_update unit tests in mock
* add mock based allocate_for_instance tests
* extract the validate and create calls into a separate method
* worry about payload going over RPC, create o.vo objects to carry data

Note: if we get all this done, it would mean we can move the port_create
next cycle, because computes will know how to skip port_create, if
needed. However, its looking dodgy to get this all done for this cycle.

blueprint prep-for-network-aware-scheduling

Change-Id: I4565a488d4054b91c39538ee4be8172c621c1675

commit_message:
WIP: Make allocate_for_instance skip create option

Once we pull out the port create and valid into a separate method, we
can call this from a different location. For backwards compatibility we
need to make sure we optionally skip the port create, if its not already
been done.

We need some prep work:
* finish port_update unit tests in mock
* add mock based allocate_for_instance tests
* extract the validate and create calls into a separate method
* worry about payload going over RPC, create o.vo objects to carry data

Note: if we get all this done, it would mean we can move the port_create
next cycle, because computes will know how to skip port_create, if
needed. However, its looking dodgy to get this all done for this cycle.

blueprint prep-for-network-aware-scheduling-ocata

Change-Id: I4565a488d4054b91c39538ee4be8172c621c1675

commit_message:
Added nova-manage cmd to list compute node metrics

Added the following nova-manage cmd to list compute node metrics:

- nova-manage host_metric list [--host=<host>]
List the metrics names stored in DB for compute node <host> or
for all compute nodes if host parameter is not provided.

- nova-manage host_metric show <host>
Show all the metrics stored in DB for the compute node <host>.

Also restore the print_list function from cliutils module which was
deleted in change set Ibef5076f9556fa3224c2ca32e8c7fe2c4c1f739b.

Change-Id: I118796e80a6f28fba78d4a4b1875f2d51231754e
Implements: blueprint compute-node-metrics-list

'}, {'number': 17, 'created': '2016-07-01 10:48:29.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/d22bce47685ad3d61f44e8e3ad4559aa500846a4', 'message': 'compute: Allow stable disk device rescues by capable virt drivers

Attempts to rescue volume backed instances were previously blocked by
the compute api. Instead these attempts should only be blocked by the
compute manager when a given virt driver lists the
supports_stable_rescue capability as False.

This change also bumps the compute service version for later use in an
API microversion to ensure that the minuium version across the
deployment is able to handle volume backed rescue requests.

commit_message:
compute: Allow stable disk device rescues by capable virt drivers

Attempts to rescue volume backed instances were previously blocked by
the compute api. Instead these attempts should only be blocked by the
compute manager when a given virt driver lists the
supports_stable_rescue capability as False.

This change also bumps the compute service version for later use in an
API microversion to ensure that the minuium version across the
deployment is able to handle volume backed rescue requests.

Implements: blueprint virt-rescue-stable-disk-devices
Change-Id: Id63341075efa12b2ec541395f82c89fb519c0915

commit_message:
libvirt: fail server create if cannot honor file injection

If the user requested to inject files when creating or rebuilding
a server but file injection is disabled on the compute host that
it's building on, we should fail the build rather than silently
ignore the files to inject.

This results in aborting the build for creating a new server rather
than rescheduling since it's assumed file injection is either enabled
or disabled globally in a deployment, so rescheduling to another
compute will not fix the issue.

A release note is added since this changes the behavior of creating
or rebuilding a server with file injection, but it was broken
behavior.

Closes-Bug: #1598581

Depends-On: Ibcf7f87feda86242de17c035fd62a86aabebf919

Change-Id: Ieb0f64847e31622bd86d1c5f4672c37b3a89f197

commit_message:
Rebuild booted from volume work

Recently, rebuild an instance booted from volume does not change
the image.

Change-Id: I13fde79012bc79943eb6ba20d9e94a9887fd068e
Closes-Bug: #1586577

commit_message:
Fixup list types handling tuples

The addition to enforce_type now tries to convert the
value (even if enforcing is off) which can result in
types the list class was not handling now being handled.

One example is someone setting an override for a tuple
go through the same code path as for lists.

Related-Bug: #1635717

Co-Authored-By: Adam Harwell <flux.adam@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Icdce83d731642724ea3ce6920b84c25d61bd63c5

commit_message:
Power on failures should put an instance into error

Failure to power on an instance should put the instance into an
error state. For example, for a failed "nova start", we were
recording the instance fault, but not changing the state of the
instance, which is just plain confusing.

Change-Id: I9fd69e95a3bd9391e06d79e5272d7e47b6c645ed
Partial-Bug: #1522667

commit_message:
Case-sensitive neutron security groups

nova-network security groups are case-sensitive. Neutron validates
security-group names regardless of case, however they would fail when
the scheduler would attempt to allocate the group to the instance
causing it to enter into an ERROR state. This patch helps in
resolving this issue by raising exception when case-insensitive name
is provided while booting VM. Now VM instead of going into error state,
shows exception to user saying security group not found.

Converted mox to mock

Co-Authored-By: Sarafraj Singh <sarafraj.singh@intel.com>

Change-Id: Ic56be21aeb7a7ef20c9f2fcab83f2b9247598c80
Closes-Bug: #1286463

VirDomainBlockJobAbort in used to abort block job during create
snapshot. The libvirtError will be raise if device has no block job.
This causes the snapshot creation fails.

In this commit, it will check block job info before abort it during
create snapshot. Abort job will not be executed if device has no
block job.

commit_message:
Check block job info before abort it

VirDomainBlockJobAbort in used to abort block job during
_live_snapshot. The libvirtError will be raise if device
has no block job. This causes the operations fails.

In this commit, it will catch the exception and raise to
manager.

Change-Id: I442e319764d772d71f9c54e5c097d5c1c8054d17
Closes-Bug: #1570734

commit_message:
[WIP] Change server delete response code

Change server delete HTTP response code according
to RFC2616 from 204 to 202, as asyncronous activity.

Change-Id: I3d3aba7ed586d377519024024b12955b06457ef0
Depends-on: I2c081878c18f2905a9509cfdbc84deec32127154
Closes-Bug: #1152623

commit_message:
[WIP] Interpret -1 as entire log length

Add -1 as valid value for nova console-log
and return entire log for this value.

Depends-on: I2c081878c18f2905a9509cfdbc84deec32127154

commit_message:
Provide user friendly messages for db sync

Currently 'nova-manage db sync' prints stacktrace if you
pass invalid value for 'version'.

This patch validates 'version' for its type and  maximum
limit. It also handles exception and displays a meaningful
message to the user.

Depends-On: I0210d56a6e85f03c44cea027f50863faaf050c1d
Closes-Bug: #1546441

Change-Id: I4f83d3d1d74b363b5f3fefe0b6c8008b3f44372a

commit_message:
Remove unused migrate_data param from driver cleanup and destroy

As long as live_migration_cleanup method was introduced,
migrate_data param became useless for drivers cleanup and destroy
methods

bp: remove-compute-compute-communication

Change-Id: I5658079a4d0e76b13d0552a604bcc459507c4b88

subject: centralize checks before live-migration
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-21 12:58:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/28a948306fae7e762db7df621c341d1c7168e5cc', 'message': 'centralize checks before live-migration

this patch moves orchestration of live-migration checks to conductor.

commit_message:
centralize checks before live-migration

this patch moves orchestration of live-migration checks to conductor.

bp: remove-compute-compute-communication

Change-Id: I2177cbbf9b660778963fd43766e6b1e940e3abd9

subject: Make sure destination will rollback if live migration fails
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-20 09:48:52.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/549580090e288f6b70f16c323d8f2f2bb7518bef', 'message': "Make sure destination will rollback if live migration fails

During live migration of instance, if the live migration fails then
'_rollback_live_migration' method will be called. Here if the
'remove_volume_connection' method throw an error, see [1], method
'rollback_live_migration_at_destination' will not be called, see [2].
This could leave resources not cleaned up on the destination, any
exception from 'remove_volume_connection' method should be handled and
the 'rollback_live_migration_at_destination' method should be called.

This commit add the exception handling logic to make sure method
'rollback_live_migration_at_destination' will be called.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/13.0.0.0b1/nova/compute/manager.py#L5440
[2] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/13.0.0.0b1/nova/compute/manager.py#L5450

Change-Id: I3976982a6c9cedcd5ad0da8155257b62a2c15635
Closes-Bug: #1535643

'rollback_live_migration_at_destination' will not be called, see [2].
This could leave resources not cleaned up on the destination, any
exception from 'remove_volume_connection' method should be handled and
the 'rollback_live_migration_at_destination' method should be called.

This commit add the exception handling logic to make sure method
'rollback_live_migration_at_destination' will be called.

'rollback_live_migration_at_destination' will not be called, see [2].
This could leave resources not cleaned up on the destination, any
exception from 'remove_volume_connection' method should be handled and
the 'rollback_live_migration_at_destination' method should be called.

This commit add the exception handling logic to make sure method
'rollback_live_migration_at_destination' will be called.

[2] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/13.0.0.0b1/nova/compute/manager.py#L5450

commit_message:
Make sure destination will rollback if live migration fails

During live migration of instance, if the live migration fails then
'_rollback_live_migration' method will be called. Here if the
'remove_volume_connection' method throw an error (say RPC layer or
underlying compute driver encountered unexpected exception), see [1].
'rollback_live_migration_at_destination' will not be called, see [2].
This could leave resources not cleaned up on the destination, any
exception from 'remove_volume_connection' method should be handled and
the 'rollback_live_migration_at_destination' method should be called.

This commit add the exception handling logic to make sure method
'rollback_live_migration_at_destination' will be called.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/13.0.0.0b1/nova/compute/manager.py#L5440
[2] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/13.0.0.0b1/nova/compute/manager.py#L5450

Change-Id: I3976982a6c9cedcd5ad0da8155257b62a2c15635
Closes-Bug: #1535643

commit_message:
VMware: configure limits during resize operation

This patch adds support to configure memory, disk and vif resource
allocation (reservation, shares, limits) while resizing an instance.
The resource allocation values are derived from flavor's extra_specs.

Implements: blueprint vmware-limits-newton
Change-Id: I238f259765527bc42cb0e4ecbe92832b83f91eac

commit_message:
call pre_live_migration from conductor

For new workflow pre_live_migration method is called from conductor
instead of compute. disk_info is now calculated during checks.

bp: remove-compute-compute-communication

Change-Id: Ie0258aa303b6f010ee3f3bd8e8e75c6b258bba11

commit_message:
live_migration_cleanup method introduced

Cleanup method in libvirt driver is used in
several cases, which make it to generic. This
patch introduced new method instead to cover
cleanup cases for live-migration

Closes-bug: #1544103
bp: remove-compute-compute-communication

Change-Id: Ieb63683b8d0da5b186cd2420ee75fb80b646becd

commit_message:
Add soft power off support to ironic driver.

This patch introduces a new power state "SOFT_POWER_OFF" to ironic driver,
and make power_off() be able to handle soft and hard power off.

Change-Id: I6d91ddd2a191138b19e756b0511a182b9c4a4441
Implements: blueprint soft-reboot-poweroff
Related-to: blueprint enhance-power-interface-for-soft-reboot-and-nmi
Co-Authored-By: Tang Chen <chen.tang@easystack.cn>

subject: manager:mark a vm that resume failed
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-08 06:45:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/750b9210b309873d19bd3e019b64c8554a17fb56', 'message': 'manager:mark a vm that resume failed

as a result, the vm will be  try to recover
the next time the service is restarted, or
until the resumption of normal human intervention

Change-Id: I72cd68ce76337b6979800ec0657cc8a9f99879c6
Closes-Bug: #1330583
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-09 09:09:04.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/cf51563dbdfe098d20f2aa9ccf5d963c0472ccff', 'message': "manager:mark a vm that resume failed

Currently, during compute node restart, when
CONF.resume_guests_state_on_host_boot is set true,
instance maybe into ERROR states because some temporary reason.
these instances will ignore during compute node next
compute node restart, so these instances need human restore.
but directly to set the vm state to ACTIVE it is not
appropriate because the vm might actually have been unavailable.

In this patch, we still set the vm state to ERROR, but we will
mark the instance in  system_metadata. during compute node's
next restart. these instance with mark will be try resume again.
those instance without mark will be ignore.
the mark of instance will be remove when instance resume to
ACTIVE.

As a result, instance can  back to ACTIVE during
compute node restart after temporary reason been resolved.

Change-Id: I72cd68ce76337b6979800ec0657cc8a9f99879c6
Closes-Bug: #1330583
"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2016-03-13 02:28:30.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/27c7b3dc946f7cd37533b8fa12f3f290ef63fe8e', 'message': "manager:mark a vm that resume failed

CONF.resume_guests_state_on_host_boot is set true,
instance maybe into ERROR states because some temporary reason.
These instances will ignore during compute node next
compute node restart, so these instances need human restore.
But directly to set the vm state to ACTIVE it is not
appropriate because the vm might actually have been unavailable.

In this patch, we still set the vm state to ERROR, but we will
mark the instance in  system_metadata. During compute node's
next restart. These instance with mark will be try resume again.
Those instance without mark will be ignore.
The mark of instance will be remove when instance resume to
ACTIVE.

As a result, instance can  back to ACTIVE during
compute node restart after temporary reason been resolved.

Change-Id: I72cd68ce76337b6979800ec0657cc8a9f99879c6
Closes-Bug: #1330583

"}, {'number': 5, 'created': '2016-05-21 06:37:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/b9263a01197fb90ceea89bed2f1e2474f1efce61', 'message': "manager:mark a vm that resume failed

Currently, during compute node restart, when
CONF.resume_guests_state_on_host_boot is set true,
instance maybe into ERROR states because some temporary reason.
These instances will ignore during compute node next
compute node restart, so these instances need human restore.
But directly to set the vm state to ACTIVE it is not
appropriate because the vm might actually have been unavailable.

In this patch, we still set the vm state to ERROR, but we will
mark the instance in  system_metadata. During compute node's
next restart. These instance with mark will be try resume again.
Those instance without mark will be ignore.
The mark of instance will be remove when instance resume to
ACTIVE.

As a result, instance can  back to ACTIVE during
compute node restart after temporary reason been resolved.

commit_message:
manager:mark a vm that resume failed

Currently, during compute node restart, when
CONF.resume_guests_state_on_host_boot is set true,
instance maybe into ERROR states because some temporary reason.
These instances will ignore during next compute node restart,
so these instances need human restore.
But directly to set the vm state to ACTIVE it is not
appropriate because the vm might actually have been unavailable.

In this patch, we still set the vm state to ERROR, but we will
mark the instance in  system_metadata. During compute node's
next restart. These instances with mark will be try resume again.
Those instances without mark will be ignore.
The mark of instance will be remove when instance resume to
ACTIVE.

As a result, instance can  back to ACTIVE during
compute node restart after temporary reason been resolved.

Change-Id: I72cd68ce76337b6979800ec0657cc8a9f99879c6
Closes-Bug: #1330583

commit_message:
DNM: Default compute upgrade_level to auto

This was introduced but not defaulted in mitaka. Since we've been
running in the gate with it set to auto for a while and are now
in the following cycle, we should default to this for better UX.

Change-Id: Id4f8ec3ccf6447d9ae7ffcb3975d5b9e06a84d7d
Related-Bug: #1566942

commit_message:
Add console log offset

Offset argument added to ComputeVirtAPI.get_console_output
to get last length lines from specified offset.

Change-Id: I048ca597b3338d6cc49b0563a4e60fba246dcee7
Implements blueprint console-log-offset
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/73/292473/38 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Add check of capabilities for detach interface

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-20 02:42:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/b63c813666b3a702f95486463f9ceb1fe641e62b', 'message': 'Add check of capabilities for detach interface and fix support matrix

to the support matrix.

commit_message:
Add check of capabilities for detach interface

In https://review.openstack.org/#/c/272471/ we
added checks of attach interface capabilies of
drivers, but the checks of detach interfaces was
forgotten. This patch add it.

Change-Id: Idaabf866f2ef7c9a78a61f520d2839d4e1612246
Closes-Bug: #1572376

commit_message:
Enable sqlite FK enforcement in Database fixture

By default, sqlite doesn't enforce foreign key constraints, so code
that deletes data from different tables in the wrong order will pass
unit and functional tests, only to fail later during tempest jobs.

This enables foreign key constraint enforcement in sqlite in the
Database fixture if the sqlite version is new enough and fixes
existing tests.

Note: sqlite foreign key constraint enforcement should not be enabled
for tests that do database migrations as table alters will fail while
it's enabled. For alembic, it is required that pragma FKs is turned
off for sqlite migrations.

Change-Id: I28836284254101e9a7ef031b04e79313522d1479

subject: Fix exception raised in exception wrapper
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-24 17:26:01.000000000', 'files': ['nova/notifications/objects/exception.py', 'nova/tests/unit/test_exception.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/f98e4aa5b70312cb75d5db92e9ab862ffcab1ca3', 'message': "Fix exception raised in exception wrapper

In some cases the exception wrapper can't find the module name for a
traceback (like lxml c extensions), resulting in an exception from
inspect.getmodule(). Just set the module name to 'unknown' in these
cases.

Change-Id: Id5e181d682598eab6987ad6f0f194c77e061f69c
Closes-Bug: #1635467
"}]
commit_message:
Fix exception raised in exception wrapper

In some cases the exception wrapper can't find the module name for a
traceback (like lxml c extensions), resulting in an exception from
inspect.getmodule(). Just set the module name to 'unknown' in these
cases.

Change-Id: Id5e181d682598eab6987ad6f0f194c77e061f69c
Closes-Bug: #1635467

commit_message:
Enable docker-registry haproxy endpoint

This allows 192.0.2.2:13787 to be used as an encrypted registry
endpoint for tools like kolla-build.

Change-Id: I89d077e6dae3343ebf4665fdf38dbfbf6775a045

commit_message:
Use 'openstack subnet list' to replace 'nova network-list'

The command "nova network-list" is deprecated and will be removed
after Nova 15.0.0 is released, and the chapter want to get IP ranges,
So this patch use 'openstack subnet list' to replace it.

partial-implements: blueprint use-openstack-command

Change-Id: Id0074c4274b9e27269b9f96c89f073bfa5225ed1

commit_message:
Add list method and query support for cinder volume and snapshot

This patch do those things:
  1. Add list method for volume and snapshot in _proxy.py
  2. Change the Volume(block_store/v2/volume.Volume)'s base class
  to resource2 to support QueryParameters.
  3. Change the Snapshot(block_store/v2/snapshot.Snapshot)'s base
  class to resource2 to support QueryParameters.
  4. Change the type(block_store/v2/type/type.Type)'s base class
  to resource2.
  5. Add query support for volume and snapshot with parameters:
  all_tenants, name, status, volume_id(snapshot only).

Change-Id: I60f537ea8fd67283fd84addb334bdd932f537635

commit_message:
Add Production Use data for Newton

Using Survey data for deployments updated between 2016-05 and 2016-10-06,
* Isolate deployments in "Production or Full Operational Use"
* Look for project usage either in "Production" or "Testing"
* Count the project use, and calculate an overall percentage by dividing by
  the number of deployments (167)

subject: Generalize endpoint determination
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-13 14:38:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk/commit/23be35b3976f2945738f4d2ea45e39cf16b4da51', 'message': "[WIP] Generalize endpoint determination

Since moving away from the service catalog for per-service
endpoint determination, we've covered most of the cases we're familiar
with, but of course a cloud can configure endpoints in other ways,
including some we're not handling properly.

Rather than just use the root of the service catalog's entry, or
using the entire entry when it doesn't include a port, we need to
automate this further to cover a number of cases at once. We can't
make a smart determination on the root endpoint by just looking at the
URI anymore--we have to make some requests and see what happens.

This change now splits the URI and looks at the parts of the path and
reconstructs a number of sub-URIs. It first pops off any tenant/project
from the given URL, and then constructs successively longer paths
eminating from the root. We then make requests to each of them until we
find a URL which gives us the response we're aiming to parse.

Given a URL like http://mycloud.com/nova/v2/blahblahtenantid, we would
make the following requests while looking for a JSON body with a list of
versions:

1. http://mycloud.com/
2. http://mycloud.com/nova/ (this is the one that would work, and we
would exit)
3. http://mycloud.com/nova/v2

In some cases, services are configured either at a particular port or
under a subdomain. This was the original case we were solving for.
Given a URL like http://nova.mycloud.com/v2/blahblahtenantid, we would
make the following requests:

1. http://nova.mycloud.com/ (this is the one that would work, and we
would exit)
2. http://nova.mycloud.com/v2/

So, this does unfortunately add one or more extra GET requests to some
cases (one time on startup only), but there is no other automated way
to properly determine a root endpoint. The only other way we could
reliably know what root endpoint to go to would involve end-users
submitting some kind of parameter to a profile or other configuration in
order to specify what their environment looks like. They really should
not have to know that, and that complicates our user experience if we
need to enforce something like that.

Change-Id: I333638aee889202d8a17bf9e3df5c797c23a03e4

commit_message:
Generalize endpoint determination

Since moving away from the service catalog for per-service
endpoint determination, we've covered most of the cases we're familiar
with, but of course a cloud can configure endpoints in other ways,
including some we're not handling properly.

Rather than just use the root of the service catalog's entry, or
using the entire entry when it doesn't include a port, we need to
automate this further to cover a number of cases at once. We can't
make a smart determination on the root endpoint by just looking at the
URI anymore--we have to make some requests and see what happens.

This change now splits the URI and looks at the parts of the path and
reconstructs a number of sub-URIs. It first pops off any tenant/project
from the given URL, and then constructs successively longer paths
eminating from the root. We then make requests to each of them until we
find a URL which gives us the response we're aiming to parse.

Given a URL like http://mycloud.com/nova/v2/blahblahtenantid, we would
make the following requests while looking for a JSON body with a list of
versions:

1. http://mycloud.com/
2. http://mycloud.com/nova/ (this is the one that would work, and we
would exit)
3. http://mycloud.com/nova/v2

In some cases, services are configured either at a particular port or
under a subdomain. This was the original case we were solving for.
Given a URL like http://nova.mycloud.com/v2/blahblahtenantid, we would
make the following requests:

1. http://nova.mycloud.com/ (this is the one that would work, and we
would exit)
2. http://nova.mycloud.com/v2/

So, this does unfortunately add one or more extra GET requests to some
cases (one time on startup only), but there is no other automated way
to properly determine a root endpoint. The only other way we could
reliably know what root endpoint to go to would involve end-users
submitting some kind of parameter to a profile or other configuration in
order to specify what their environment looks like. They really should
not have to know that, and that complicates our user experience if we
need to enforce something like that.

Change-Id: I333638aee889202d8a17bf9e3df5c797c23a03e4

This patch adds support for using a workflow in tripleo-common
for deleting nodes from a stack (scale down).

commit_message:
Fix fernet related components added to fact var properly.

Previous version of keystone reconfigure fails at adding fernet
components to fact variable "keystone_item".
Ansible can not create fact variable using newly created variable
in a same task.

This patch set split this task into two tasks, first create variable
containing fernet components, then merge it to "keystone_item".

Change-Id: I15571ab20d6104d30350e8b922401b462336fca0
Closes-Bug: #1636047
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/78/390178/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Don't attempt to escalate rally-manage privileges

Remove code which allowed rally-manage to attempt to escalate
privileges so that configuration files can be read by users who
normally wouldn't have access, but do have sudo access.

Change-Id: Iff352e463189738d3f371c819edfeb0664fd7684
Closes-Bug:#1611171

commit_message:
Fix api_paste_config option

Option "api_paste_config" from group "DEFAULT" is deprecated
in Nova.
Use option "api_paste_config" from group "wsgi".

Change-Id: I7267c0f93f745219611cf6f508f5953d545f0c44
(cherry picked from commit 48c99a5231adafa72b280fba2b37392a7dda55da)

commit_message:
Make module name and file name equivalent

Newer checkmodule commands have a requirement that the selinux module
name and file name are equivalent. This patch updates the ipxe element
to match that requirement.

This patch is applied directly to mitaka since the ipxe element was
removed in newton. Upon merging the plan is to apply to liberty as well.

Change-Id: Id01e8084a238d939bbef2c82e1baa82812dc64b3
Closes-Bug: #1635030

We currently set the stonith property from all controller nodes during

commit_message:
Fix the stonith property during upgrades

We currently set the stonith property from all controller nodes during
upgrade. This is racy and can actually end up disabling stonith after
the upgrade even if when it was enabled.

Let's set the property only from the bootstrap node.

Change-Id: Id4afb867b485ac853be874a0179a7ed7cc914068
Closes-Bug: #1635294

commit_message:
Avoid use xx=[] for parameter to initialize it's value

This patch is deprecated use xx = [] for the parameter initial value,
this parameter will only be initialized at the first call,this is not
what we expected.
Better choice is to set the initial value to None,
then initialize xx with xx= xx or [] in method body.

More details:http://effbot.org/zone/default-values.htm

Change-Id: Iee0648fd500422f48c3f7f35b5066fdc644ae308

Fix errors due to repo_service_user_name setting

Changing the paths of nginx logs to not rely on the
 user name of repo service. This is because nginx related
 configurations, playbooks assume nginx in the directory names.

Added kafka and psutil requirements for devstack

Kafka and psutil are required in the python runtime to run smoke tests.  Without
them the devstack plugin fails to complete.

commit_message:
Modified ImageNameType class & modified UTs

ImageNameType was inherreting to String Class, this patch
chnages that and now ImageNameType inherits from NameType
class because they both have similar functionality. And
this patch also modifies some UTs to strengthen them to cover
positive test cases too.

Change-Id: I79a1199258b2e1140d70b2c1645d1ca861fd7c38

commit_message:
Increase haproxy client/server timeout for swift-proxy

The upload and extraction for the plan tarball to swift can take
longer than the default one minute in slower environments. Doubling
the timeout to two minutes has proven to help.

This is only a partial fix, because the error reporting for this
issue also needs to be improved.

Change-Id: I06592d38fdfefacc8bdf76289a0bfa20eb33a89b
Partial-Bug: 1635269

subject: Use TEST-NET-1 for unit tests, not 127.0.0.1
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-11 23:18:09.000000000', 'files': ['os_collect_config/tests/test_keystone.py', 'os_collect_config/tests/test_request.py', 'os_collect_config/tests/test_zaqar.py', 'os_collect_config/heat.py', 'os_collect_config/tests/test_heat.py', 'os_collect_config/tests/test_collect.py', 'os_collect_config/tests/test_cfn.py', 'os_collect_config/zaqar.py', 'os_collect_config/keystone.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/os-collect-config/commit/61ff6aaec75337e91b0750396b58f5e651902034', 'message': "Use TEST-NET-1 for unit tests, not 127.0.0.1

Currently if http requests are not correctly mocked, behaviour of the
unit tests will depend on what happens to be running on localhost.

Jobs like gate-os-collect-config-python27-ubuntu-xenial are currently
broken because discover requests are being made to localhost and
something has change in the environment to cause test failure.

This change does the following:
- replace unit tests addresses from 127.0.0.1 to 192.0.2.1 (TEST-NET-1)
- fix mocking of tests which now stall because 192.0.2.1 isn't accessable
- change the mocking approach to keystoneclient.discover.Discover to
  a simple stub class

Change-Id: I6d9450d6854b9f50dac0f55f54f1ea1d579a27ac
"}]
commit_message:
Use TEST-NET-1 for unit tests, not 127.0.0.1

Currently if http requests are not correctly mocked, behaviour of the
unit tests will depend on what happens to be running on localhost.

Jobs like gate-os-collect-config-python27-ubuntu-xenial are currently
broken because discover requests are being made to localhost and
something has change in the environment to cause test failure.

This change does the following:
- replace unit tests addresses from 127.0.0.1 to 192.0.2.1 (TEST-NET-1)
- fix mocking of tests which now stall because 192.0.2.1 isn't accessable
- change the mocking approach to keystoneclient.discover.Discover to
  a simple stub class

Change-Id: I6d9450d6854b9f50dac0f55f54f1ea1d579a27ac

commit_message:
Dell SC: Can incorrectly identify if it is failed over

Driver was only checking active_backend_id against None when
it should have been checking against None or an empty string.

Change-Id: Ib62b28742f32f3522a92f2f140e23ba5472eef8d
Closes-Bug: #1631149

subject: Allow passing list of dicts for create-vms-conf command.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-05 09:25:02.000000000', 'files': ['fuelclient/tests/unit/v2/cli/test_node.py', 'fuelclient/commands/node.py', 'fuelclient/tests/unit/common/test_utils.py', 'fuelclient/utils.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-fuelclient/commit/d0f6840a48f6c3aafa6aafae38439ead364ff831', 'message': 'Allow passing list of dicts for create-vms-conf command.

Previous implementation of command "fuel2 node create-vms-conf"
didn't allow using list of dicts for --conf parameter. It required
to use multiple arguments like:
    --conf '{"id": 1}' '{"id": 2}'
which is non obvious for user and inconsistent with UI (in UI
user sees list of dicts).
This patch introduces new possibility to pass parameters
as json list:
    --conf '[{"id": 1}, {"id": 2}]'

Conflicts:
	fuelclient/commands/node.py
	fuelclient/tests/unit/common/test_utils.py

Change-Id: I50e961c1afce91fd1c43d1fdcf6436a08a20c2be
Related-Bug: #1582136
Closes-Bug: #1582120
(cherry-picked from commit 39f6f5f0453ba5c3f23aea26300af0fb71b40dc1)
'}]
commit_message:
Allow passing list of dicts for create-vms-conf command.

Previous implementation of command "fuel2 node create-vms-conf"
didn't allow using list of dicts for --conf parameter. It required
to use multiple arguments like:
    --conf '{"id": 1}' '{"id": 2}'
which is non obvious for user and inconsistent with UI (in UI
user sees list of dicts).
This patch introduces new possibility to pass parameters
as json list:
    --conf '[{"id": 1}, {"id": 2}]'

Conflicts:
	fuelclient/commands/node.py
	fuelclient/tests/unit/common/test_utils.py

Change-Id: I50e961c1afce91fd1c43d1fdcf6436a08a20c2be
Related-Bug: #1582136
Closes-Bug: #1582120
(cherry-picked from commit 39f6f5f0453ba5c3f23aea26300af0fb71b40dc1)

commit_message:
Add upgrade notes for new REST_API_REQUIRED_SETTINGS

These two settings are required in REST_API_REQUIRED_SETTINGS
and need to be mentioned for deployments upgrading from
previous Horizon versions.

Change-Id: I9b80c3f299634fc54fafa1085a8ca65108740c51
Partial-Bug: 1632383
(cherry picked from commit 71bb8ae61c1cb8997f8fcd7144b1b1dae3375fa8)

subject: Skip set of OVSDB connection manager target
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-22 18:17:04.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/09f572f28d3b6907710e6ca63d5d0f2727ceee99', 'message': "Log OVS connection URI exception and continue

When starting a native OVS connection, the 'ovs-vsctl set-manager'
command will be run if the initial OVS connection attempt fails in
hopes that a subsequent retry will then succeed. However, if the
command itself fails, the retry won't be attempted and the original
connection error will be masked. This patch set fixes the problem
by logging the command exception and continuing with the retry.

Change-Id: Ie62ba229d599ecbb4980dc034bdc9e0f38917e1f
Partial-Bug: #1612435
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-09-01 15:45:11.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/4bb8d50eb3a6fe0975f5aacf8eb7024d29c69b94', 'message': "Skip set of OVSDB connection manager target

When starting a native OVSDB connection, the 'ovs-vsctl set-manager'
command will be run if the initial OVSDB connection attempt fails in
hopes that a subsequent retry will then succeed. However, callers
may not require this functionality. In particular deployments
(such as networking-ovn), the ovs-vsctl command may not be
available on the node establishing the connection. This will result
in the command failing, the subsequent connection retry getting
skipped, and the original connection error being masked.

Change-Id: Ie62ba229d599ecbb4980dc034bdc9e0f38917e1f

commit_message:
Skip set of OVSDB connection manager target

When starting a native OVSDB connection, the 'ovs-vsctl set-manager'
command will be run if the initial OVSDB connection attempt fails in
hopes that a subsequent retry will then succeed. However, callers
may not require this functionality. In particular deployments
(such as networking-ovn), the ovs-vsctl command may not be
available on the node establishing the connection. This will result
in the command failing, the subsequent connection retry getting
skipped, and the original connection error being masked.

Change-Id: Ie62ba229d599ecbb4980dc034bdc9e0f38917e1f
Partial-Bug: #1612435

subject: Add __ne__ built-in function
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-05 05:42:44.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-glanceclient/commit/4e4b135dd194a99ae77adf6c06f433ac54d855dc', 'message': 'Add __ne__ built-in function

In Python 3 __ne__ by default delegates to __eq__ and inverts the
result, but in Python 2 they urge you to define __ne__ when you
define __eq__ for it to work properly [1].There are no implied
relationships among the comparison operators. The truth of x==y
does not imply that x!=y is false. Accordingly, when defining
__eq__(), one should also define __ne__() so that the operators
will behave as expected.
[1]https://docs.python.org/2/reference/datamodel.html#object.__ne__

Change-Id: I518d408e8959d3e854ebafc2016f66d654c96b79
Closes-Bug: #1586268
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-10 07:35:54.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-glanceclient/commit/cccee10b5b8e612239859e5c24d3a47b47eb9d50', 'message': 'Add __ne__ built-in function

In Python 3 __ne__ by default delegates to __eq__ and inverts the
result, but in Python 2 they urge you to define __ne__ when you
define __eq__ for it to work properly [1].There are no implied
relationships among the comparison operators. The truth of x==y
does not imply that x!=y is false. Accordingly, when defining
__eq__(), one should also define __ne__() so that the operators
will behave as expected.
[1]https://docs.python.org/2/reference/datamodel.html#object.__ne__

Without the change in base.py, if r1=r2, the follow code should
all pass.
    self.assertEqual(r1, r2)
    self.assertNotEqual(r1, r2)
The change here is for a way to assert self.assertNotEqual(r1, r2)
is false.

"not self.__eq__(other)" vs "not self == other"
If self and other NotImplemented, self.__eq__(other) return NotImplemented
and not self.__eq__(other) is false, but self == other return false and
not self == other is true. So we should use "not self == other" instead
of "not self.__eq__(other)".

Closes-Bug: #1586268

commit_message:
Add __ne__ built-in function

In Python 3 __ne__ by default delegates to __eq__ and inverts the
result, but in Python 2 they urge you to define __ne__ when you
define __eq__ for it to work properly [1].There are no implied
relationships among the comparison operators. The truth of x==y
does not imply that x!=y is false. Accordingly, when defining
__eq__(), one should also define __ne__() so that the operators
will behave as expected.
[1]https://docs.python.org/2/reference/datamodel.html#object.__ne__

Without the change in base.py, if r1=r2, the follow code should
all pass.
    self.assertEqual(r1, r2)
    self.assertNotEqual(r1, r2)
The change here is for a way to assert self.assertNotEqual(r1, r2)
is false.

"not self.__eq__(other)" vs "not self == other"
If self and other NotImplemented, self.__eq__(other) return NotImplemented
and not self.__eq__(other) is false, but self == other return false and
not self == other is true. So we should use "not self == other" instead
of "not self.__eq__(other)".

Change-Id: I518d408e8959d3e854ebafc2016f66d654c96b79
Closes-Bug: #1586268

commit_message:
Fix errors due to repo_service_user_name setting

Changing the paths of nginx logs to not rely on the
 user name of repo service. This is because nginx related
 configurations, playbooks assume nginx in the directory names.

Change-Id: I2fb0ec7a2f6a1d536363d1b2056394b6534287cf
Closes-Bug: #1633739

commit_message:
Fix errors due to repo_service_user_name setting

Changing the paths of nginx logs to not rely on the
 user name of repo service. This is because nginx related
 configurations, playbooks assume nginx in the directory names.

Change-Id: I458293c687c1857e7d8451a200173bec554d9559
Closes-Bug: #1633739

commit_message:
Fixed issue on compute nodes iteration

In this changeset, I fixed the issue with the basic server
consolidation strategy to now loop over all compute nodes
as expected instead of stopping after the first one.

Change-Id: If594f0df41e39dfb0ef8f0fce41822018490c4ec
Closes-bug: #1548874

subject: Pecan: Bulk create with one item returns plural
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-21 00:14:50.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/functional/pecan_wsgi/test_controllers.py', 'neutron/pecan_wsgi/hooks/body_validation.py', 'neutron/pecan_wsgi/controllers/resource.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/64252405c4780f09b376655b1b439543290a2f65', 'message': 'Pecan: Bulk create with one item returns plural

If a bulk create happened with a single item, the pecan code would
return back to the user the singular version of the resource in the
body.  For example, to bulk create many security group rules, the user
would give in the body of the request the json with a parent key of
"security-group-rules" with a value of a list of json security group
rules.  If this list is of length one, then after the creation of the
one security group rule, the API would return back to the client
"security-group-rule" as the parent key.  This is not how the legacy
wsgi layer behaved.  The behavior is expected when nova creates security
group rules by calling the neutron API through its deprecated security
groups API.

Change-Id: I8757630403e4d486cd3c8dd6f041e9ee326ba3b4
Closes-Bug: #1633671
'}]
commit_message:
Pecan: Bulk create with one item returns plural

If a bulk create happened with a single item, the pecan code would
return back to the user the singular version of the resource in the
body.  For example, to bulk create many security group rules, the user
would give in the body of the request the json with a parent key of
"security-group-rules" with a value of a list of json security group
rules.  If this list is of length one, then after the creation of the
one security group rule, the API would return back to the client
"security-group-rule" as the parent key.  This is not how the legacy
wsgi layer behaved.  The behavior is expected when nova creates security
group rules by calling the neutron API through its deprecated security
groups API.

Change-Id: I8757630403e4d486cd3c8dd6f041e9ee326ba3b4
Closes-Bug: #1633671

commit_message:
Add support for db_max_retries param

The db_max_retries parameter regulates the number of reconnection
attempts performed after an error raised rather than at startup.

Change-Id: Ie38148a1826a75327de61b91007ce7cc825c2b80
Closes-Bug: 1579718

commit_message:
Avoid duplicated project_id when show network

Project_id appear twice when show network. This
patch check and not append if it already has one.

Change-Id: I4400239f454522101b639a0412050dd60eb6a612
Closes-Bug: #1636123
Partially-Implements: blueprint duplicated-project-id

subject: Allow passing app_name and app_version for useragent
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-18 04:53:44.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/osc-lib/commit/9e22c840c5227db0c576ebbfa5c220efabcf2bda', 'message': 'Allow passing app_name and app_version for useragent

Keystoneauth now supports passing app_name and app_version when creating
the session to build a sensible user agent string including client
versions. osc-lib and OpenStack Client should be amongst the first to
support this.

Change-Id: Ia46c1eea29678824a5934d846a08dbe52f5058d0

commit_message:
Allow passing app_name and app_version for useragent

Keystoneauth now supports passing app_name and app_version when creating
the session to build a sensible user agent string including client
versions. osc-lib and OpenStack Client should be amongst the first to
support this.

Change-Id: Ia46c1eea29678824a5934d846a08dbe52f5058d0

subject: Remove '::processorcount' fact from tests.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-10 15:55:44.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-murano/commit/f38381b180243cfe3f1173e797d7760f023b6950', 'message': 'Change worker defaults to ::os_workers

This patch changes the default worker count from ::processorcount to the
new ::os_workers fact. ::os_workers is based on the number of processors
(currently cpu/4) but is capped at a maximum of 8 worker processors.
This is a much more reasonable default in general and prevents excessive
resource consumption on systems with a large number of CPUs.

commit_message:
Deprecate auth_plugin option

Option "auth_plugin" from group "trustee" is deprecated in Heat.
Use option "auth_type" from group "trustee" instead.

Change-Id: I19024ad7be968c7364dbb8ff94372a168f6f6096
Closes-Bug: #1633282

commit_message:
Fix errors due to repo_service_user_name setting

Changing the paths of nginx logs to not rely on the
 user name of repo service. This is because nginx related
 configurations, playbooks assume nginx in the directory names.

Change-Id: I84f7e029ff0ce5d0c79acbd2e401d93d8fd2963c
Closes-Bug: #1633739

commit_message:
Fix murano-agent image building

In heartbeat jobs for murano-agent where
ZUUL_PROJECT variable is by default set
to openstack/murano we need properly set DIB_MURANO_AGENT_REPO
and fix make_img_with_murano_agent function

Change-Id: Icc3e962621e95f13f27ac68ba7aef430966fe585
Closes-Bug: #1635793

subject: Using assertIsNone() instead of assertEqual(None)
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-22 09:33:55.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/34b52d877879bb095b677a128d5d3646219db41f', 'message': "[TrivialFix] Replace old style assertions with new style assertions

Replace 'assertEqual(...,None)' with 'assertIsNone()'.
Replace 'assertEqual(...,True) ' with 'assertTrue()'.
Replace 'assertEqual(...,False)' with 'assertFalse()'.

Change-Id: I8cbac0ae6eeddd8d12c2652acff16a370f2066bb
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-10-24 03:43:06.000000000', 'files': ['tests/test_inventory.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/7874a8d1032aa5210d7cde90e295500b2c3bc62e', 'message': 'Using assertIsNone() instead of assertEqual(None)

Following OpenStack Style Guidelines[1]:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#unit-tests-and-assertraises
[H203] Unit test assertions tend to give better messages for more specific assertions.
As a result, assertIsNone(...) is preferred over assertEqual(None, ...)

Change-Id: I8cbac0ae6eeddd8d12c2652acff16a370f2066bb
'}]
commit_message:
Using assertIsNone() instead of assertEqual(None)

Following OpenStack Style Guidelines[1]:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#unit-tests-and-assertraises
[H203] Unit test assertions tend to give better messages for more specific assertions.
As a result, assertIsNone(...) is preferred over assertEqual(None, ...)

Change-Id: I8cbac0ae6eeddd8d12c2652acff16a370f2066bb

commit_message:
[upstream] change version: 2014.11.01 -> 2016.2

Currently, when upstream training slide materials are linked to
somewhere, the following title will be shown:
"Commit messages - Upstream Training Guide 2014.11.01 documentation"

This is because of old version numbers.
Version numbers need to be changed accordingly following X.Y format.

Change-Id: I48f52052656ed2ed2a7b75313268a96fb50801d7

commit_message:
Remove '::processorcount' fact from tests.

As '::processorcount' fact is not used anymore,
it was removed from tests.

commit_message:
Fix api_paste_config option

Option "api_paste_config" from group "DEFAULT" is deprecated
in Nova.
Use option "api_paste_config" from group "wsgi".

Change-Id: I7267c0f93f745219611cf6f508f5953d545f0c44

subject: Identify virt type of PowerVM and KVM on Power
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-22 07:32:39.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/nova_virt_detect.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_nova/commit/d4ac3a123c2796801c288ae5d0151b28eb9b7c9e', 'message': 'Identify virt type of PowerVM and KVM on Power

Using platform and model values as the criteria to distinguish KVM
on Power from PowerVM. Further info of platform and model is listed below.
- Host for KVM on Power
  platform        : PowerNV
  model           : 8247-22L
- VM running on KVM on Power
  platform        : pSeries
  model           : IBM pSeries (emulated by qemu)
- PowerVM (VM or NovaLink host)
  platform        : pSeries
  model           : IBM,8247-22L

Change-Id: I3d19ada78038caafdb3a89e8ddf5a91041e31e60
(cherry picked from commit e659628047997cc03e71162ae52ccfd02249fade)
'}]
commit_message:
Identify virt type of PowerVM and KVM on Power

Using platform and model values as the criteria to distinguish KVM
on Power from PowerVM. Further info of platform and model is listed below.
- Host for KVM on Power
  platform        : PowerNV
  model           : 8247-22L
- VM running on KVM on Power
  platform        : pSeries
  model           : IBM pSeries (emulated by qemu)
- PowerVM (VM or NovaLink host)
  platform        : pSeries
  model           : IBM,8247-22L

Change-Id: I3d19ada78038caafdb3a89e8ddf5a91041e31e60
(cherry picked from commit e659628047997cc03e71162ae52ccfd02249fade)

commit_message:
Implement mechanism for plugin node attributes

Provide ability for plugins to add additional attributes for nodes.
* Added new NodeAttributesDefaultsHandler handler for getting
  default node attributes.
* Added code stuff for getting and updating additional plugin
  node attributes.
* Added code stuff to serialize plugin node attributes for orchestrator.

Change-Id: I5c6d6f3c815a034683e624b98fa1f360ab4b491c
Implements: blueprint nics-and-nodes-attributes-via-plugin

Add -test package for python-manilaclient

Package consumers may want to run the unit- or functional tests.

to the new -test subpackage.
